title: (b) BODY FUNCTIONS
description:
Broad ranges of percentages are provided for those cases in which calibrated assessment instruments or other standards are available to quantify the impairment in body function.
For example, when no impairment or complete impairment in body function is coded, this scaling may have margin of error of up to 5%. Moderate impairment is generally up to half of the scale of total impairment. The percentages are to be calibrated in different domains with reference to population standards as percentiles. For this quantification to be used in a uniform manner, assessment procedures need to be developed through research.
For a further explanation of coding conventions in ICF, refer to Annex 2.

children.title: (b1) MENTAL FUNCTIONS
children.description: This chapter is about the functions of the brain: both global mental functions, such as consciousness, energy and drive, and specific mental functions, such as memory, language and calculation mental functions.

children.title: (b110) Consciousness functions
children.description:
General mental functions of the state of awareness and alertness, including the clarity and continuity of the wakeful state. 
 Inclusions: functions of the state, continuity and quality of consciousness; loss of consciousness; coma, vegetative states, fugues, trance states, possession states, drug-induced altered consciousness, delirium, stupor 
 Exclusions: orientation functions (b114); energy and drive functions (b130); sleep functions (b134)

children.title: (b1100) State of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that when altered produce states such as clouding of consciousness, stupor or coma.

children.title: (b1101) Continuity of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that produce sustained wakefulness, alertness and awareness and, when disrupted, may produce fugue, trance or other similar states.

children.title: (b1102) Quality of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that when altered effect changes in the character of wakeful, alert and aware sentience, such as druginduced altered states or delirium.

children.title: (b114) Orientation functions
children.description:
General mental functions of knowing and ascertaining one's relation to time, to place, to self, to others, to objects and to space. 
 Inclusions: functions of orientation to time, place and person; orientation to self and others; disorientation to time, place and person 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); attention functions (b140); memory functions (b144)

children.title: (b1140) Orientation to time
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of time of the day, day of the week, date, month and year.

children.title: (b1141) Orientation to place
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's location, such as one's immediate surroundings, one's town or country.

children.title: (b1142) Orientation to person
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's own identity and of individuals in the immediate environment.

children.title: (b11420) Orientation to self
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's own identity.

children.title: (b11421) Orientation to others
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of the identity of other individuals in one's immediate environment.

children.title: (b1143) Orientation to objects
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of objects or features of objects.

children.title: (b1144) Orientation to space
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of oneâ€™s body in relation to the immediate physical space.

children.title: (b117) Intellectual functions
children.description:
General mental functions, required to understand and constructively integrate the various mental functions including all cognitive functions and their development over the life span. 
 Inclusions: functions of intellectual growth; intellectual retardation, mental retardation, dementia 
 Exclusions: memory functions (b144); thought functions (b160); higher level cognitive functions (b164)

children.title: (b122) Global psychosocial functions
children.description:
General mental functions, as they develop over the life span, required to understand and constructively integrate the mental functions that lead to the formation of the personal skills needed to establish reciprocal social interactions, in terms of both meaning and purpose.
 Inclusions: such as in autism

children.title: (b126) Temperament and personality functions
children.description:
General mental functions of constitutional disposition of the individual to react in a particular way to situations, including the set of mental characteristics that makes the individual distinct from others. 
 Inclusions: functions of extraversion, introversion, agreeableness, conscientiousness, psychic and emotional stability, and openness to experience; optimism; novelty seeking; confidence; trustworthiness
 Exclusions: intellectual functions (b117); energy and drive functions (b130); psychomotor functions (b147); emotional functions (b152)

children.title: (b1260) Extraversion
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is outgoing, sociable and demonstrative, as contrasted to being shy, restricted and inhibited.

children.title: (b1261) Agreeableness
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cooperative, amicable, and accomodating, as contrasted to being unfriendly, oppositional and defiant.

children.title: (b1262) Conscientiousness
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition such as in being hard-working, methodical and scrupulous, as contrasted to mental functions producing dispositions such as being lazy, unreliable and irresponsible.

children.title: (b1263) Psychic stability
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is even-tempered, calm and composed, as contrasted to being irritable, worried, erratic and moody.

children.title: (b1264) Openness to experience
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is curious, imaginative, inquisitive and experience-seeking, as contrasted to being stagnant, inattentive and emotionally inexpressive.

children.title: (b1265) Optimism
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cheerful, buoyant and hopeful, as contrasted to being downhearted, gloomy and despairing.

children.title: (b1266) Confidence
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is self-assured, bold and assertive, as contrasted to being timid, insecure and self effacing.

children.title: (b1267) Trustworthiness
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is dependable and principled, as contrasted to being deceitful and antisocial.

children.title: (b1268) Temperament and personality functions, other specified
(b130) Energy and drive functions
children.description:
General mental functions of physiological and psychological mechanisms that cause the individual to move towards satisfy specific needs and general goals in a persistent manner. 
 Inclusions: functions of energy level, motivation, appetites, craving (including craving for substances that can be abused), and impulse control 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); temperament and personality functions (b126); sleep functions (b134); psychomotor functions (b147); emotional functions (b152)

children.title: (b1300) Energy level
children.description: Mental functions that produce vigour and stamina.

children.title: (b1301) Motivation
children.description: Mental functions that produce the incentive to act; the conscious or unconscious driving force for action.

children.title: (b1302) Appetites
children.description: Mental functions that produce a natural longing or desire, especially the natural and recurring desire for food and drink.

children.title: (b1303) Craving
children.description: Mental functions that produce the urge to consume substances, including substances that can be abused.

children.title: (b1304) Impulse control
children.description: Mental functions that regulate and resist sudden intense urges to do something.

children.title: (b1308) Energy and drive functions, other specified
(b134) Sleep functions
children.description:
General mental functions of periodic, reversible and selective physical and mental disengagement from one's immediate environment accompanied by characteristic physiological changes. 
 Inclusions: functions of amount of sleeping, and onset, maintenance and quality of sleep; functions involving the sleep cycle, such as in insomnia, hypersomnia and narcolepsy 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); energy and drive functions (b130); attention functions (b140); psychomotor functions (b147)

children.title: (b1340) Amount of sleep
children.description: Mental functions involved in the time spent in the state of sleep in the diurnal cycle or circadian rhythm.

children.title: (b1341) Onset of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that produce the transition between wakefulness and sleep.

children.title: (b1342) Maintenance of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that sustain the state of being asleep.

children.title: (b1343) Quality of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that produce the natural sleep leading to optimal physical and mental rest and relaxation.

children.title: (b1344) Functions involving the sleep cycle
children.description: Mental functions that produce rapid eye movement (REM) sleep (associated with dreaming) and non-rapid eye movement sleep (NREM) (characterized by the traditional concept of sleep as a time of decreased physiological and psychological activity).

children.title: (b139) Global mental functions, other specified and unspecified
(b140) Attention functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions of focusing on an external stimulus or internal experience for the required period of time. 
 Inclusions: functions of sustaining attention, shifting attention, dividing attention, sharing attention; concentration; distractibility 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); energy and drive functions (b130); sleep functions (b134); memory functions (b144); psychomotor functions (b147); perceptual functions (b156)

children.title: (b1400) Sustaining attention
children.description: Mental functions that produce concentration for the period of time required.

children.title: (b1401) Shifting attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit refocusing concentration from one stimulus to another.

children.title: (b1402) Dividing attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on two or more stimuli at the same time.

children.title: (b140) Sharing attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on the same stimulus by two or more people, such as a child and a caregiver both focusing on a toy.

children.title: (b144) Memory functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions of registering and storing information and retrieving it as needed. 
 Inclusions: functions of short-term and long-term memory, immediate, recent and remote memory; memory span; retrieval of memory; remembering; functions used in recalling and learning, such as in nominal, selective and dissociative amnesia 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); orientation functions (b114), intellectual functioning (b117), attention functions (b140), perceptual functions (b156); thought functions (b160), higher-level cognitive functions (b164), mental functions of language (b167); calculation functions (b172)

children.title: (b1440) Short-term memory
children.description: Mental functions that produce a temporary, disruptable memory store of around 30 seconds duration from which information is lost if not consolidated into long-term memory.

children.title: (b1441) Long-term memory
children.description: Mental functions that produce a memory system permitting the long-term storage of information from short-term memory and both autobiographical memory for past events and semantic memory for language and facts.

children.title: (b1442) Retrieval and processing of memory
children.description: Specific mental functions of recalling information stored in long-term memory and bringing it into awareness.

children.title: (b144) Working memory
children.description: Mental functions that compare and process information retrieved from both short-term and long-term memory.

children.title: (b147) Psychomotor functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions of control over both motor and psychological events at the body level. 
 Inclusions: functions of psychomotor control, such as in psychomotor retardation, excitement and agitation, posturing, catatonia, negativism, ambitendency, echopraxia and echolalia; quality of psychomotor function. 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); orientation functions (b114); intellectual functions (b117); energy and drive functions (b130); attention functions (b140); mental functions of language (b167); mental function of sequencing complex movements (b176)

children.title: (b1470) Psychomotor control
children.description: Mental functions that regulate the speed of behaviour or response time that involves both motor and psychological components, such as in disruption of control producing psychomotor retardation (moving and speaking slowly; decrease in gesturing and spontaneity) or psychomotor excitement (excessive behavioural and cognitive activity, usually nonproductive and often in response to inner tension as in toe-tapping, hand-wringing, agitation, or restlessness).

children.title: (b1471) Quality of psychomotor functions
children.description: Mental functions that produce nonverbal behaviour in the proper sequence and character of its subcomponents, such as hand and eye coordination, or gait.

children.title: (b152) Emotional functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions related to the feeling and affective components of the processes of the mind. 
 Inclusions: functions of appropriateness of emotion, regulation and range of emotion; affect, sadness, happiness, love, fear, anger, hate, tension, anxiety, joy, sorrow; lability of emotion; flattening of affect 
 Exclusions: temperament and personality functions (b126); energy and drive functions (b130)

children.title: (b1520) Appropriateness of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that produce congruence of feeling or affect with the situation, such as happiness at receiving good news.

children.title: (b1521) Regulation of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that control the experience and display of affect.

children.title: (b1522) Range of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that produce the spectrum of experience of arousal of affect or feelings such as love, hate, anxiousness, sorrow, joy, fear and anger.

children.title: (b156) Perceptual functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions of recognizing and interpreting sensory stimuli. 
 Inclusions: functions of auditory, visual, olfactory, gustatory, tactile and visuospatial perception, such as in hallucination or illusion 
 Exclusions: consciousness functions (b110); orientation functions (b114); attention functions (b140); memory functions (b144); mental functions of language (b167); seeing and related functions (b210-b229), hearing and vestibular functions (b230-b249); additional sensory functions (b250-b279)

children.title: (b1560) Auditory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating sounds, tones, pitches and other acoustic stimuli.

children.title: (b1561) Visual perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating shape, size, colour and other ocular stimuli.

children.title: (b1562) Olfactory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in smells.

children.title: (b1563) Gustatory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in tastes, such as sweet, sour, salty and bitter stimuli, detected by the tongue.

children.title: (b1564) Tactile perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in texture, such as rough or smooth stimuli, detected by touch.

children.title: (b1565) Visuospatial perception
children.description:
Mental function involved in distinguishing by sight the relative position of objects in the environment or in relation to oneself. 
 
 Exclusions: orientation to objects (b1143)

children.title: (b160) Thought functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions related to the ideational component of the mind. 
 Inclusions: functions of pace, form, control and content of thought; goaldirected thought functions, non-goal directed thought functions; logical thought functions, such as pressure of thought, flight of ideas, thought block, incoherence of thought, tangentiality, circumstantiality, delusions, obsessions and compulsions 
 Exclusions: intellectual functions (b117); memory functions (b144); psychomotor functions (b147); perceptual functions (b156); higher-level cognitive functions (b164); mental functions of language (b167); calculation functions (b172)

children.title: (b1600) Pace of thought
children.description: Mental functions that govern speed of the thinking process.

children.title: (b1601) Form of thought
children.description:
Mental functions that organize the thinking process as to its coherence and logic. 
 Inclusions: impairments of ideational perseveration, tangentiality and circumstantiality

children.title: (b1602) Content of thought
children.description:
Mental functions consisting of the ideas that are present in the thinking process and what is being conceptualized. 
 Inclusions: impairments of delusions, overvalued ideas and somatization

children.title: (b1603) Control of thought
children.description:
Mental functions consisting of the ideas that are present in the thinking process and what is being conceptualized. 
 Inclusions: impairments of delusions, overvalued ideas and somatization

children.title: (b164) Higher-level cognitive functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions especially dependent on the frontal lobes of the brain, including complex goal-directed behaviours such as decision-making, abstract thinking, planning and carrying out plans, mental flexibility, and deciding which behaviours are appropriate under what circumstances; often called executive functions. 
 Inclusions: functions of abstraction and organization of ideas; time management, insight and judgement; concept formation, categorization and cognitive flexibility 
 Exclusions: memory functions (b144); thought functions (b160); mental functions of language (b167); calculation functions (b172)

children.title: (b1640) Abstraction
children.description: Mental functions of creating general ideas, qualities or characteristics out of, and distinct from, concrete realities, specific objects or actual instances.

children.title: (b1641) Organization and planning
children.description: Mental functions of coordinating parts into a whole, of systematizing; the mental function involved in developing a method of proceeding or acting.

children.title: (b1642) Time management
children.description: Mental functions of ordering events in chronological sequence, allocating amounts of time to events and activities.

children.title: (b1643) Cognitive flexibility
children.description: Mental functions of changing strategies, or shifting mental sets, especially as involved in problem-solving.

children.title: (b1644) Insight
children.description: Mental functions of awareness and understanding of oneself and one's behaviour.

children.title: (b1645) Judgement
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating between and evaluating different options, such as those involved in forming an opinion.

children.title: (b1646) Problem Solving
children.description: Mental functions of identifying, analysing, and integrating incongruent or conflicting information into a solution.

children.title: (b167) Mental functions of language
children.description:
Specific mental functions of recognizing and using signs, symbols and other components of a language. 
 Inclusions: functions of reception and decryption of spoken, written or other forms of language such as sign language; functions of expression of spoken, written, or other forms of language; integrative language functions spoken and written, such as involved in receptive, expressive, Broca's, Wernicke's and conduction aphasia 
 Exclusions: attention functions (b140); memory functions (b144); perceptual functions (b156); thought functions (b160); higher-level cognitive functions (b164); calculation functions (b172); mental function of complex movements (b176); Chapter 2 Sensory Functions and Pain (b2); Chapter 3 Voice and Speech Functions (b3)

children.title: (b1670) Reception of language
children.description: Specific mental functions of decoding messages in spoken, written or other forms, such as sign language, to obtain their meaning.

children.title: (b16700) Reception of spoken language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding spoken messages to obtain their meaning.

children.title: (b16701) Reception of written language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding written messages to obtain their meaning.

children.title: (b16702) Reception of sign language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding messages in languages that use signs made by hands and other movements, in order to obtain their meaning.

children.title: (b16703) Reception of body language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding messages in body gestures made by hands or other movements, in order to obtain their meaning.

children.title: (b1671) Expression of language
children.description: Specific mental functions necessary to produce meaningful messages in spoken, written, signed or other forms of language.

children.title: (b16710) Expression of spoken language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce meaningful spoken messages.

children.title: (b16711) Expression of written language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce meaningful written messages.

children.title: (b16712) Expression of sign language
children.description: Mental functions to produce meaningful messages in languages that use signs made by hands and other movements.

children.title: (b16713) Expression of body language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce messages using body gestures made by hands or other movements.

children.title: (b1672) Integrative language functions
children.description: Mental functions that organize semantic and symbolic meaning, grammatical structure and ideas for the production of messages in spoken, written or other forms of language.

children.title: (b1678) Mental functions of language, other specified
(b1679) Mental functions of language
children.description: Mental functions of language, unspecified

children.title: (b172) Calculation functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions of determination, approximation and manipulation of mathematical symbols and processes. 
 Inclusions: functions of addition, subtraction, and other simple mathematical calculations; functions of complex mathematical operations 
 Exclusions: attention functions (b140); memory functions (b144); thought functions (b160); higher-level cognitive functions (b164); mental functions of language (b167)

children.title: (b1720) Simple calculation
children.description: Mental functions of computing with numbers, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

children.title: (b1721) Complex calculation
children.description: Mental functions of translating word problems into arithmetic procedures, translating mathematical formulas into arithmetic procedures, and other complex manipulations involving numbers.

children.title: (b176) Mental function of sequencing complex movements
children.description:
Specific mental functions of determination, approximation and manipulation of mathematical symbols and processes. 
 Inclusions: functions of addition, subtraction, and other simple mathematical calculations; functions of complex mathematical operations 
 Exclusions: attention functions (b140); memory functions (b144); thought functions (b160); higher-level cognitive functions (b164); mental functions of language (b167)

children.title: (b180) Experience of self and time functions
children.description:
Specific mental functions related to the awareness of one's identity, one's body, one's position in the reality of one's environment and of time. 
 Inclusions: functions of experience of self, body image and time

children.title: (b1800) Experience of self
children.description:
Specific mental functions of being aware of one's own identity and one's position in the reality of one's environment around oneself. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as depersonalization and derealization

children.title: (b1801) Body image
children.description:
Specific mental functions related to the representation and awareness of one's body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as phantom limb and feeling too fat or too thin

children.title: (b1802) Experience of time
children.description:
Specific mental functions of the subjective experiences related to the length and passage of time. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as jamais vu and déjà vu

children.title: (b1808) Experience of self and time functions, other specified
(b1809) Experience of self and time functions, unspecified
(b189) Specific mental functions, other specified and unspecified
(b2) SENSORY FUNCTIONS AND PAIN
children.description: This chapter is about the functions of the senses, seeing, hearing, tasting and so on, as well as the sensation of pain.

children.title: (b210) Seeing functions
children.description:
Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of light and sensing the form, size, shape and colour of the visual stimuli. 
 Inclusions: visual acuity functions; visual field functions; quality of vision; functions of sensing light and colour, visual acuity of distant and near vision, monocular and binocular vision; visual picture quality; impairments such as myopia, hypermetropia, astigmatism, hemianopia, colour-blindness, tunnel vision, central and peripheral scotoma, diplopia, night blindness and impaired adaptability to light 
 Exclusions: perceptual functions (b156)

children.title: (b2100) Visual acuity functions
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing form and contour, both binocular and monocular, for both distant and near vision.

children.title: (b21000) Binocular acuity of distant vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour using both eyes for objects distant from the eye.

children.title: (b21001) Monocular acuity of distant vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour using either right or left eye alone, for objects distant from the eye.

children.title: (b21002) Binocular acuity of near vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using both eyes, for objects close to the eye.

children.title: (b21003) Monocular acuity of near vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using either right or left eye alone, for objects close to the eye.

children.title: (b2101) Visual field functions
children.description:
Seeing functions related to the entire area that can be seen with fixation of gaze. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in scotoma, tunnel vision, anopsia

children.title: (b2102) Quality of vision
children.description: Seeing functions involving light sensitivity, colour vision, contrast sensitivity and the overall quality of the picture.

children.title: (b21020) Light sensitivity
children.description:
Seeing functions of sensing a minimum amount of light (light minimum), and the minimum difference in intensity (light difference). 
 Inclusions: functions of dark adaptation; impairments such as night blindness (hyposensitivity to light) and photophobia (hypersensitivity to light)

children.title: (b21021) Colour vision
children.description: Seeing functions of differentiating and matching colours.

children.title: (b21022) Contrast sensitivity
children.description: Seeing functions of separating figure from ground, involving the minimum amount of luminance required.

children.title: (b21023) Visual picture quality
children.description:
Seeing functions involving the quality of the picture. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in seeing stray lights; affected picture quality (floaters or webbing); picture distortion, and seeing stars or flashes

children.title: (b215) Functions of structures adjoining the eye
children.description:
Functions of structures in and around the eye that facilitate seeing functions. 
 Inclusions: functions of internal muscles of the eye, eyelid, external muscles of the eye, including voluntary and tracking movements and fixation of the eye, lachrymal glands, accommodation, pupillary reflex; impairments such as in nystagmus, xerophthalmia and ptosis 
 Exclusions: seeing functions (b210); Chapter 7 Neuromusculoskeletal and Movement-related Functions (b7)

children.title: (b2150) Functions of internal muscles of the eye
children.description:
Functions of the muscles inside the eye, such as the iris, that adjust the shape and size of the pupil and lens of the eye. 
 Inclusions: functions of accommodation; pupillar reflex

children.title: (b2151) Functions of the eyelid
children.description: Functions of the eyelid, such as the protective reflex.

children.title: (b2152) Functions of external muscles of the eye
children.description:
Functions of the muscles that are used to look in different directions, to follow an object as it moves across the visual field, to produce saccadic jumps to catch up with a moving target, and to fix the eye. 
 Inclusions: nystagmus; cooperation of both eyes

children.title: (b2153) Functions of lachrymal glands
children.description: Functions of the tear glands and ducts.

children.title: (b2158) Functions of structures adjoining the eye, other specified8
(b2159) Functions of structures adjoining the eye, unspecified
(b220) Sensations associated with the eye and adjoining structures
children.description:
Sensations of tired, dry and itching eye and related feelings. 
 Inclusions: feelings of pressure behind the eye, of something in the eye, eye strain, burning in the eye; eye irritation 
 Exclusions: sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b229) Seeing and related functions, other specified and unspecified
(b230) Hearing functions
children.description:
Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sounds and discriminating the location, pitch, loudness and quality of sounds. 
 Inclusions: functions of hearing, auditory discrimination, localization of sound source, lateralization of sound, speech discrimination; impairments such as deafness, hearing impairment and hearing loss 
 Exclusions: perceptual functions (b156) and mental functions of language (b167)

children.title: (b2300) Sound detection
children.description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sounds.

children.title: (b2301) Sound discrimination
children.description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sound involving the differentiation of ground and binaural synthesis, separation and blending.

children.title: (b2302) Localization of sound source
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining the location of the source of sound.

children.title: (b2303) Lateralization of sound
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining whether the sound is coming from right or the left side.

children.title: (b2304) Speech discrimination
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining spoken language and distinguishing it from other sounds.

children.title: (b235) Vestibular functions
children.description:
Sensory functions of the inner ear related to position, balance and movement. 
 Inclusions: functions of position and positional sense; functions of balance of the body and movement 
 Exclusions: sensation associated with hearing and vestibular functions (b240)

children.title: (b2350) Vestibular function of position
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining the position of the body.

children.title: (b2351) Vestibular function of balance
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining the balance of the body.

children.title: (b2352) Vestibular function of determination of movement
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining movement of the body, including its direction and speed.

children.title: (b240) Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function
children.description:
Sensations of dizziness, falling, tinnitus and vertigo. 
 Inclusions: sensations of ringing in ears, irritation in ear, aural pressure, nausea associated with dizziness or vertigo 
 Exclusions: vestibular functions (b235); sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b2400) Ringing in ears or tinnitus
children.description: Sensation of low-pitched rushing, hissing or ringing in the ear.

children.title: (b2401) Dizziness
children.description: Sensation of motion involving either oneself or one's environment; sensation of rotating, swaying or tilting.

children.title: (b2402) Sensation of falling
children.description: Sensation of losing one's grip and falling.

children.title: (b2403) Nausea associated with dizziness or vertigo
children.description: Sensation of wanting to vomit that arises from dizziness or vertigo.

children.title: (b2404) Irritation in the ear
children.description: Sensation of itching or other similar sensations in the ear.

children.title: (b2405) Aural pressure
children.description: Sensation of pressure in the ear.

children.title: (b2408) Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function, other specified
(b2409) Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function, unspecified
(b249) Hearing and vestibular functions, other specified and unspecified
(b250) Taste function
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing qualities of bitterness, sweetness, sourness and saltiness. 
 Inclusions: gustatory functions; impairments such as ageusia and hypogeusia

children.title: (b255) Smell function
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing odours and smells. 
 Inclusions: functions of smelling, olfactory functions; anosmia, hyposmia

children.title: (b260) Proprioceptive function
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing the relative position of body parts. 
 Inclusions: functions of statesthesia and kinaesthesia 
 Exclusions: vestibular functions (b235); sensations related to muscles and movement functions (b780)

children.title: (b265) Touch function
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing surfaces and their texture or quality. 
 Inclusions: functions of touching, feeling of touch; impairments such as numbness, anaesthesia, tingling, paraesthesia and hyperaesthesia 
 Exclusions: sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli (b270)

children.title: (b270) Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing temperature, vibration, pressure and noxious stimulus. 
 Inclusions: functions of being sensitive to temperature, vibration, shaking or oscillation, superficial pressure, deep pressure, burning sensation or a noxious stimulus 
 Exclusions: touch functions (b265); sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b2700) Sensitivity to temperature
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing cold and heat.

children.title: (b2701) Sensitivity to vibration
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing shaking or oscillation.

children.title: (b2702) Sensitivity to pressure
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing pressure against or on the skin. 
 Inclusions: sensitivity to touch, numbness, hypaesthesia, hyperaesthesia, paraesethesia, tingling

children.title: (b2703) Sensitivity to a noxious stimulus
children.description:
Sensory functions of sensing painful or uncomfortable sensations. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as hypalgesia, hyperpathia, allodynia, analgesia and anaesthesia dolorosa

children.title: (b2708) Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli, other specified
(b2709) Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli, unspecified
(b279) Additional sensory functions, other specified and unspecified
(b280) Sensation of pain
children.description:
Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure. 
 Inclusions: sensations of generalized or localized pain, in one or more body part, pain in a dermatome, stabbing pain, burning pain, dull pain, aching pain; impairments such as myalgia, analgesia and hyperalgesia

children.title: (b2800) Generalized pain
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt all over, or throughout the body.

children.title: (b2801) Pain in body part
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in a specific part, or parts, of the body.

children.title: (b28010) Pain in head and neck
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the head and neck.

children.title: (b28011) Pain in chest
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the chest.

children.title: (b28012) Pain in stomach or abdomen
children.description:
Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the stomach or abdomen. 
 Inclusions: pain in the pelvic region

children.title: (b28013) Pain in back
children.description:
Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the back. 
 Inclusions: pain in the trunk; low backache

children.title: (b28014) Pain in upper limb
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in either one or both lower limbs, including feet.

children.title: (b28015) Pain in lower limb
children.description:
Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in one or more joints, including small and big joints. 
 Inclusions: pain in the hip; pain in the shoulder

children.title: (b28016) Pain in joints
children.description:
Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in one or more joints, including small and big joints. 
 Inclusions: pain in the hip; pain in the shoulder

children.title: (b28018) Pain in body part, other specified
(b2802) Pain in multiple body parts
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in several body parts.

children.title: (b2803) Radiating pain in a dermatome
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in areas of skin served by the same nerve root.

children.title: (b2804) Radiating pain in a segment or region
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in areas of skin in different body parts not served by the same nerve root.

children.title: (b289) Sensation of pain, other specified and unspecified
(b298) Sensory functions and pain, other specified
(b299) Sensory functions and pain, other specified unspecified
(b3) VOICE AND SPEECH FUNCTIONS
children.description: This chapter is about the functions of producing sounds and speech.

children.title: (b310) Voice functions
children.description:
Functions of the production of various sounds by the passage of air through the larynx. 
 Inclusions: functions of production and quality of voice; functions of phonation, pitch, loudness and other qualities of voice; impairments such as aphonia, dysphonia, hoarseness, hypernasality and hyponasality 
 Exclusions: mental functions of language (b167); articulation functions (b320); alternative vocalization functions (b340)

children.title: (b3100) Production of voice
children.description:
Functions of the production of sound made through coordination of the larynx and surrounding muscles with the respiratory system. 
 Inclusions: functions of phonation, loudness, impairment of aphonia

children.title: (b3101) Quality of voice
children.description:
Functions of the production of characteristics of voice including pitch, resonance and other features. 
 Inclusions: functions of high or low pitch; impairments such as hypernasality, hyponasality, dysphonia, hoarseness or harshness

children.title: (b320) Articulation functions
children.description:
Functions of the production of speech sounds. 
 Inclusions: functions of enunciation, articulation of phonemes; spastic, ataxic, flaccid dysarthria; anarthria 
 Exclusions: mental functions of language (b167); voice functions (b310)

children.title: (b330) Fluency and rhythm of speech functions
children.description:
Functions of the production of flow and tempo of speech. 
 Inclusions: functions of fluency, rhythm, speed and melody of speech; prosody and intonation; impairments such as stuttering, stammering, cluttering, bradylalia and tachylalia 
 Exclusions: mental functions of language (b167); voice functions (b310); articulation functions (b320)

children.title: (b3300) Fluency of speech
children.description:
Functions of the production of smooth, uninterrupted flow of speech. 
 Inclusions: functions of smooth connection of speech; impairments such as stuttering, stammering, cluttering, dysfluency, repetition of sounds, words or parts of words and irregular breaks in speech

children.title: (b3301) Rhythm of speech
children.description:
Functions of the modulated, tempo and stress patterns in speech. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as stereotypic or repetitive speech cadence

children.title: (b3302) Speed of speech
children.description:
Functions of the rate of speech production. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as bradylalia and tachylalia

children.title: (b3303) Melody of speech
children.description:
Functions of modulation of pitch patterns in speech. 
 Inclusions: prosody of speech, intonation, melody of speech; impairments such as monotone speech

children.title: (b3308) Fluency and rhythm of speech functions, other specified
(b3309) Fluency and rhythm of speech functions, unspecified
(b340) Alternative vocalization functions
children.description:
Functions of the production of other manners of vocalization. 
 Inclusions: functions of the production of tones and range of sounds, such as in singing, chanting, babbling and humming; crying aloud and screaming 
 Exclusions: mental functions of language (b167); voice functions (b310); articulation functions (b320); fluency and rhythm of speech functions (b330)

children.title: (b3400) Production of tones
children.description:
Functions of production of musical vocal sounds. 
 Inclusions: sustaining, modulating and terminating production of single or connected vocalizations with variation in pitch such as in singing, humming and chanting

children.title: (b3401) Making a range of sounds
children.description:
Functions of production of a variety of vocalizations. 
 Inclusions: functions of crying, cooing, gurgling, and babbling, e.g. in children

children.title: (b398) Voice and speech functions, other specified
(b4) FUNCTIONS OF THE CARDIOVASCULAR, HAEMATOLOGICAL, IMMUNOLOGICAL AND RESPIRATORY SYSTEMS
children.description: This chapter is about the functions involved in the cardiovascular system (functions of the heart and blood vessels), the haematological and immunological systems (functions of blood production and immunity), and the respiratory system (functions of respiration and exercise tolerance).

children.title: (b410) Heart functions
children.description:
Functions of pumping the blood in adequate or required amounts and pressure throughout the body. 
 Inclusions: functions of heart rate, rhythm and output; contraction force of ventricular muscles; functions of heart valves; pumping the blood through the pulmonary circuit; dynamics of circulation to the heart; impairments such as tachycardia, bradycardia and irregular heart beat and as in heart failure, cardiomyopathy, myocarditis, and coronary insufficiency 
 Exclusions: blood vessel functions (b415); blood pressure functions (b420); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4100) Heart rate
children.description:
Functions related to the number of times the heart contracts every minute. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as rates that are too fast (tachycardia) or too slow (bradycardia)

children.title: (b4101) Heart rhythm
children.description:
Functions related to the regularity of the beating of the heart. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as arrhythmias

children.title: (b4102) Contraction force of ventricular muscles
children.description:
Functions related to the amount of blood pumped by the ventricular muscles during every beat. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as diminished cardiac output

children.title: (b4103) Blood supply to the heart
children.description:
Functions related to the volume of blood available to the heart muscle. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as coronary ischaemia

children.title: (b415) Blood vessel functions
children.description:
Functions of transporting blood throughout the body. 
 Inclusions: functions of arteries, capillaries and veins; vasomotor function; functions of pulmonary arteries, capillaries and veins; functions of valves of veins, blockage or constriction of arteries; atherosclerosis, arteriosclerosis, thromboembolism and varicose veins 
 Exclusions: heart functions (b410); blood pressure functions (b420); haematological system functions (b430); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4150) Functions of arteries
children.description:
Functions related to blood flow in the arteries. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in arterial dilation; arterial constriction such as in intermittent claudication

children.title: (b4151) Functions of capillaries
children.description: Functions related to blood flow in the capillaries.

children.title: (b4152) Functions of veins
children.description:
Functions related to blood flow in the veins, and the functions of valves of veins. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as venous dilation; venous constriction; insufficient closing of valves as in varicose veins

children.title: (b420) Blood pressure functions
children.description:
Functions of maintaining the pressure of blood within the arteries. 
 Inclusions: functions of maintenance of blood pressure; increased and decreased blood pressure; impairments such as in hypotension, hypertension and postural hypotension 
 Exclusions: heart functions (b410); blood vessel functions (b415); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4200) Increased blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to a rise in systolic or diastolic blood pressure above normal for the age.

children.title: (b420) Decreased blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to a fall in systolic or diastolic blood pressure below normal for the age.

children.title: (b4202) Maintenance of blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to maintaining an appropriate blood pressure in response to changes in the body.

children.title: (b429) Functions of the cardiovascular system, other specified and unspecified
(b430-439) Functions of the haematological and immunological systems
(b430) Haematological system functions
children.description:
Functions of blood production, oxygen and metabolite carriage, and clotting. 
 Inclusions: functions of the production of blood and bone marrow; oxygen-carrying functions of blood; blood-related functions of spleen; metabolite carrying functions of blood; clotting impairments such as anaemia, haemophilia and other clotting dysfunctions 
 Exclusions: functions of the cardiovascular system (b410-b429); immunological system functions (b435); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4300) Production of blood
children.description: Functions related to the production of blood and all its constituents.

children.title: (b4301) Oxygen-carrying functions of the blood
children.description: Functions related to the blood's capacity to carry oxygen throughout the body.

children.title: (b4302) Metabolite-carrying functions of the blood
children.description: Functions related to the blood's capacity to carry metabolites throughout the body.

children.title: (b4303) Clotting functions
children.description: Functions related to the coagulation of blood, such as at a site of injury.

children.title: (b435) Immunological system functions
children.description:
Functions of the body related to protection against foreign substances, including infections, by specific and non-specific immune responses. 
 Inclusions: immune response (specific and non-specific); hypersensitivity reactions; functions of lymphatic vessels and nodes; functions of cell mediated immunity, antibody-mediated immunity; response to immunization; impairments such as in autoimmunity, allergic reactions, lymphadenitis and lymphoedema 
 Exclusions: haematological system functions (b430)

children.title: (b4350) Immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's response of sensitization to foreign substances, including infections.

children.title: (b43500) Specific immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's response of sensitization to a specific foreign substance.

children.title: (b43501) Non-specific immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's general response of sensitization to foreign substances, including infections.

children.title: (b4351) Hypersensitivity reactions
children.description:
Functions of the body's response of increased sensitization to foreign substances, such as in sensitivities to different antigens. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as hypersensitivities or allergies 
 Exclusions: tolerance to food (b5153)

children.title: (b4352) Functions of lymphatic vessels
children.description: Functions related to vascular channels that transport lymph.

children.title: (b4353) Functions of lymph nodes
children.description: Functions related to glands along the course of lymphatic vessels.

children.title: (b439) Functions of the haematological and immunological systems, other specified and unspecified
(b440) Respiration functions
children.description:
Functions of inhaling air into the lungs, the exchange of gases between air and blood, and exhaling air. 
 Inclusions: functions of respiration rate, rhythm and depth; impairments such as apnoea, hyperventilation, irregular respiration, paradoxical respiration, and bronchial spasm, and as in pulmonary emphysema; reduction in airflow through upper and lower airways 
 Exclusions: respiratory muscle functions (b445); additional respiratory functions (b450); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4400) Respiration rate
children.description:
Functions related to the number of breaths taken per minute. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as rates that are too fast (tachypnoea) or too slow (bradypnoea)

children.title: (b4401) Respiratory rhythm
children.description:
Functions related to the periodicity and regularity of breathing. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as irregular breathing

children.title: (b4402) Depth of respiration
children.description:
Functions related to the volume of expansion of the lungs during breathing. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as superficial or shallow respiration

children.title: (b445) Respiratory muscle functions
children.description:
Functions of the muscles involved in breathing. 
 Inclusions: functions of thoracic respiratory muscles; functions of the diaphragm; functions of accessory respiratory muscles 
 Exclusions: respiration functions (b440); additional respiratory functions (b450); exercise tolerance functions (b455)

children.title: (b4450) Functions of the thoracic respiratory muscles
children.description: Functions of the thoracic muscles involved in breathing.

children.title: (b4451) Functions of the diaphragm
children.description: Functions of the diaphragm as involved in breathing.

children.title: (b4452) Functions of accessory respiratory muscles
children.description: Functions of the additional muscles involved in breathing.

children.title: (b450-469) Additional functions and sensations of the cardiovascular and respiratory systems
(b450) Additional functions of the respiratory system
children.description:
Additional functions related to breathing, such as producing and transporting airway secretions, coughing, sneezing and yawning. 
 Inclusions: functions of blowing, whistling and mouth breathing

children.title: (b4500) Functions of breathing thorugh the mouth
children.description: Inclusions: functions of blowing and whistling

children.title: (b45048) Functions related to mucus, other specified
(b45049) Functions related to mucus, not specified
(b4508) Additional functions of the respiratory system, other specified
(b4509) Additional functions of the respiratory system, unspecified
(b455) Exercise tolerance functions
children.description:
Functions related to respiratory and cardiovascular capacity as required for enduring physical exertion. 
 Inclusions: functions of physical endurance, aerobic capacity, stamina and fatiguability 
 Exclusions: functions of the cardiovascular system (b410-b429); haematological system functions (b430); respiration functions (b440); respiratory muscle functions (b445); additional respiratory functions (b450)

children.title: (b4550) General physical endurance
children.description: Functions related to the general level of tolerance of physical exercise or stamina.

children.title: (b4551) Aerobic capacity
children.description: Functions related to the extent to which a person can exercise without getting out of breath.

children.title: (b4552) Fatiguability
children.description: Functions related to susceptibility to fatigue, at any level of exertion.

children.title: (b460) Sensations associated with cardiovascular and respiratory functions
children.description:
Sensations such as missing a heart beat, palpitation and shortness of breath. 
 Inclusions: sensations of tightness of chest, feelings of irregular beat, dyspnoea, air hunger, choking, gagging and wheezing 
 Exclusions: sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b469) Additional functions and sensations of the cardiovascular and respiratory systems, other specified and unspecified
(b498) Functions of the cardiovascular, haematological, immunological and respiratory systems, other specified
(b499) Functions of the cardiovascular, haematological, immunological and respiratory systems, unspecified
(b5) FUNCTIONS OF THE DIGESTIVE, METABOLIC AND ENDOCRINE SYSTEMS
children.description: This chapter is about the functions of ingestion, digestion and elimination, as well as functions involved in metabolism and the endocrine glands.

children.title: (b510-539) Functions related to the digestive system
(b510) Ingestion functions
children.description:
Functions related to taking in and manipulating solids or liquids through the mouth into the body. 
 Inclusions: functions of sucking, chewing and biting, manipulating food in the mouth, salivation, swallowing, burping, regurgitation, spitting and vomiting; impairments such as dysphagia, aspiration of food, aerophagia, excessive salivation, drooling and insufficient salivation 
 Exclusions: sensations associated with digestive system (b535)

children.title: (b5100) Sucking
children.description: Functions of drawing into the mouth by a suction force produced by movements of the cheeks, lips and tongue.

children.title: (b5101) Biting
children.description: Functions of cutting into, piercing or tearing off food with the front teeth.

children.title: (b5102) Chewing
children.description: Functions of crushing, grinding and masticating food with the back teeth (e.g. molars).

children.title: (b5103) Manipulation of food in the mouth
children.description: Functions of moving food around the mouth with the teeth and tongue.

children.title: (b5104) Salivation
children.description: Function of the production of saliva within the mouth.

children.title: (b5105) Swallowing
children.description:
Functions of clearing substances, such as food, drink or saliva through the oral cavity, pharynx and oesophagus into the stomach at an appropriate rate and speed. 
 Inclusions: oral, pharyngeal or oesophageal dysphagia; impairments in oesophageal passage substances

children.title: (b51050) Oral swallowing
children.description:
Function of clearing substances through the oral cavity at an appropriate rate and speed. 
 Inclusions: drooling

children.title: (b51051) Pharyngeal swallowing
children.description: Function of clearing substances through the pharynx at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: (b51052) Oesophageal swallowing
children.description: Function of clearing substances through the oesophagus at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: (b5106) Functions of expelling the contents of the stomach, oesophagus or pharynx
children.description: Functions of moving substances such as food, liquid, medications, objects intentionally or unintentionally swallowed in the reverse direction to ingestion, such as in regurgitation and vomiting.

children.title: (b51068) Functions of expelling the contents of the stomach, oesophagus, or pharynx, other specified
(b51069) Functions of expelling the contents of the stomach,oesophagus, or pharynx, unspecified
(b5150) Transport of food through stomach and intestines
children.description: Peristalsis and related functions that mechanically move food through stomach and intestines.

children.title: (b5151) Breakdown of food
children.description: Functions of mechanically reducing food to smaller particles in the gastrointestinal tract.

children.title: (b5152) Absorption of nutrients
children.description: Functions of passing food and drink nutrients into the blood stream from along the intestines.

children.title: (b5153) Tolerance to food
children.description:
Functions of accepting suitable food and drink for digestion and rejecting what is unsuitable. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as hypersensitivities, gluten intolerance

children.title: (b520) Assimilation functions
children.description:
Functions by which nutrients are converted into components of the living body. 
 Inclusions: functions of storage of nutrients in the body 
 Exclusions: digestive functions (b515); defecation functions (b525); weight maintenance functions (b530); general metabolic functions (b540)

children.title: (b525) Defecation functions
children.description:
Functions of elimination of wastes and undigested food as faeces and related functions. 
 Inclusions: functions of elimination, faecal consistency, frequency of defecation; faecal continence, flatulence; impairments such as constipation, diarrhoea, watery stool and anal sphincter incompetence or incontinence 
 Exclusions: digestive functions (b515); assimilation functions (b520); sensations associated with the digestive system (b535)

children.title: (b5250) Elimination of faeces
children.description: Functions of the elimination of waste from the rectum, including the functions of contraction of the abdominal muscles in doing so.

children.title: (b5251) Faecal consistency
children.description: Consistency of faeces such as hard, firm, soft or watery.

children.title: (b5252) Frequency of defecation
children.description: Functions involved in the frequency of defecation.

children.title: (b5253) Faecal continence
children.description: Functions involved in voluntary control over the elimination function.

children.title: (b5254) Flatulence
children.description: Functions involved in the expulsion of excessive amounts of air or gases from the intestines.

children.title: (b530) Weight maintenance functions
children.description:
Functions of maintaining appropriate body weight, including weight gain during the developmental period. 
 Inclusions: functions of maintenance of acceptable Body Mass Index (BMI); and impairments such as underweight, cachexia, wasting, overweight, emaciation and such as in primary and secondary obesity 
 Exclusions: assimilation functions (b520); general metabolic functions (b540); endocrine gland functions (b555)

children.title: (b535) Sensations associated with the digestive system
(b5350) Sensation of nausea
children.description: Sensation of needing to vomit.

children.title: (b5351) Feeling bloated
children.description: Sensation of distension of the stomach or abdomen.

children.title: (b5352) Sensation of abdominal cramp
children.description: Sensation of spasmodic or painful muscular contractions of the smooth muscles of the gastrointestinal tract.

children.title: (b5358) Sensations associated with the digestive system, other specified
(b5359) Sensations associated with the digestive system, unspecified
(b539) Functions related to the digestive system, other specified and unspecified
(b540-559) Functions related to metabolism and the endocrine system
(b540) General metabolic functions
children.description:
Functions of regulation of essential components of the body such as carbohydrates, proteins and fats, the conversion of one to another, and their breakdown into energy. 
 Inclusions: functions of metabolism, basal metabolic rate, metabolism of carbohydrate, protein and fat, catabolism, anabolism, energy production in the body; increase or decrease in metabolic rate 
 Exclusions: assimilation functions (b520); weight maintenance functions (b530); water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions (b545); thermoregulatory functions (b550); endocrine glands functions (b555)

children.title: (b5400) Basal metabolic rate
children.description:
Functions involved in oxygen consumption of the body at specified conditions of rest and temperature. 
 Inclusions: increase or decrease in basic metabolic rate; impairments such as in hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism

children.title: (b5401) Carbohydrate metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which carbohydrates in the diet are stored and broken down into glucose and subsequently into carbon dioxide and water.

children.title: (b5402) Protein metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which proteins in the diet are converted to amino acids and broken down further in the body.

children.title: (b5403) Fat metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which fat in the diet is stored and broken down in the body.

children.title: (b545) Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions
children.description:
Functions of the regulation of water, minerals and electrolytes in the body. 
 Inclusions: functions of water balance, balance of minerals such as calcium, zinc and iron, and balance of electrolytes such as sodium and potassium; impairments such as in water retention, dehydration, hypercalcaemia, hypocalcaemia, iron deficiency, hypernatraemia, hyponatraemia, hyperkalaemia and hypokalaemia 
 Exclusions: haematological system functions (b430); general metabolic functions (b540); endocrine gland functions (b555)

children.title: (b5450) Water balance
children.description:
Functions involved in maintaining the level or amount of water in the body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in dehydration and rehydration

children.title: (b54500) Water retention
children.description: Functions involved in keeping water in the body.

children.title: (b54501) Maintenance of water balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining the optimal amount of water in the body.

children.title: (b5451) Mineral balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining an equilibrium between intake, storage, utilization and excretion of minerals in the body.

children.title: (b5452) Electrolyte balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining an equilibrium between intake, storage, utilization and excretion of electrolytes in the body.

children.title: (b5458) Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions, other specified
(b5459) Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions, unspecified
(b550) Thermoregulatory functions
children.description:
Functions of the regulation of body temperature. 
 Inclusions: functions of maintenance of body temperature; impairments such as hypothermia, hyperthermia 
 Exclusions: general metabolic functions (b540); endocrine gland functions (b555)

children.title: (b5500) Body temperature
children.description:
Functions involved in regulating the core temperature of the body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as hyperthermia or hypothermia

children.title: (b5501) Maintenance of body temperature
children.description:
Functions involved in maintaining optimal body temperature as environmental temperature changes. 
 Inclusions: tolerance to heat or cold

children.title: (b555) Endocrine gland functions
children.description:
Functions of production and regulation of hormonal levels in the body, including cyclical changes.
 Inclusions: functions of hormonal balance, hyperpituitarism, hypopituitarism, hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, hyperadrenalism, hypoadrenalism, hyperparathyroidism, hypoparathyroidism, hypergonadism, hypogonadism 
 Exclusions: general metabolic functions (b540); water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions (b545); thermoregulatory functions (b550); sexual functions (b640); menstruation functions (b650)

children.title: (b5550) Endocrine gland functions
children.description: Functions associated with the onset of puberty and manifestations of primary and secondary sexual characteristics.

children.title: (b55500) Body and pubic hair development
children.description: Functions associated with development of body and pubic hair.

children.title: (b55501) Breast and nipple development
children.description: Functions associated with breast and nipple development.

children.title: (b55502) Penis, testes and scrotum development
children.description: Functions associated with development of penis, testes and scrotum.

children.title: (b559) Functions related to metabolism and the endocrine system, other specified and unspecified
(b598) Functions of the digestive, metabolic and endocrine systems, other specified
(b599) Functions of the digestive, metabolic and endocrine systems, unspecified
(b6) GENITOURINARY AND REPRODUCTIVE FUNCTIONS
children.description: This chapter is about the functions of urination and the reproductive functions, including sexual and procreative functions.

children.title: (b610) Urinary excretory functions
children.description:
Functions of filtration and collection of the urine. 
 Inclusions: functions of urinary filtration, collection of urine; impairments such as in renal insufficiency, anuria, oliguria, hydronephrosis, hypotonic urinary bladder and ureteric obstruction 
 Exclusions: urination functions (b620)

children.title: (b6100) Filtration of urine
children.description: Functions of filtration of urine by the kidneys.

children.title: (b6101) Collection of urine
children.description: Functions of collection and storage of urine by the ureters and bladder.

children.title: (b620) Urination functions
children.description:
Functions of discharge of urine from the urinary bladder. 
 Inclusions: functions of urination, frequency of urination, urinary continence; impairments such as in stress, urge, reflex, overflow, continuous incontinence, dribbling, automatic bladder, polyuria, urinary retention and urinary urgency 
 Exclusions: urinary excretory functions (b610); sensations associated with urinary functions (b630)

children.title: (b6200) Urination
children.description:
Functions of voiding the urinary bladder. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in urine retention

children.title: (b6201) Frequency of urination
children.description: Functions involved in the number of times urination occurs.

children.title: (b6202) Urinary continence
children.description:
Functions of control over urination. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in stress, urge, reflex, continuous and mixed incontinence

children.title: (b630) Sensations associated with urinary functions
children.description:
Sensations arising from voiding and related urinary functions.
 Inclusions: sensations of incomplete voiding of urine, feeling of fullness of bladder 
 Exclusions: sensations of pain (b280); urination functions (b620)

children.title: (b639) Urinary functions, other specified and unspecified
(b640) Sexual functions
children.description:
Mental and physical functions related to the sexual act, including the arousal, preparatory, orgasmic and resolution stages. 
 Inclusions: functions of the sexual arousal, preparatory, orgasmic and resolution phase; functions related to sexual interest, performance, penile erection, clitoral erection, vaginal lubrication, ejaculation, orgasm; impairments such as in impotence, frigidity, vaginismus, premature ejaculation, priaprism and delayed ejaculation 
 Exclusions: procreation functions (b660); sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions (b670)

children.title: (b6400) Functions of sexual arousal phase
children.description: Functions of sexual interest and excitement.

children.title: (b6401) Functions of sexual preparatory phase
children.description: Functions of engaging in sexual intercourse.

children.title: (b6402) Functions of orgasmic phase
children.description: Functions of reaching orgasm.

children.title: (b6403) Functions of sexual resolution phase
children.description:
Functions of satisfaction after orgasm and accompanying relaxation. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as dissatisfaction with orgasm

children.title: (b650) Menstruation functions
children.description:
Functions associated with the menstrual cycle, including regularity of menstruation and discharge of menstrual fluids. 
 Inclusions: functions of regularity and interval of menstruation, extent of menstrual bleeding, menarche, menopause; impairments such as primary and secondary amenorrhoea, menorrhagia, polymenorrhoea, retrograde menstruation and premenstrual tension 
 Exclusions: sexual functions (b640); procreation functions (b660); sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions (b670); sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b6500) Regularity of menstrual cycle
children.description:
Functions involved in the regularity of the menstrual cycle. 
 Inclusions: too frequent or too few occurrences of menstruation

children.title: (b6501) Interval between menstruation
children.description: Functions relating to the length of time between two menstrual cycles.

children.title: (b6502) Extent of menstrual bleeding
children.description:
Functions involved in the quantity of menstrual flow. 
 Inclusions: too little menstrual flow (hypomenorrhoea); too much menstrual flow (menorrhagia, hypermenorrhoea)

children.title: (b6503) Onset of menstruation
children.description: Functions related to the onset of the first menstruation (menarche).

children.title: (b6504) Cessation of menstruation
children.description:
Functions related to the temporary or permanent cessation of menstruation. 
 Inclusions: amenorrhea, menopause, praecoxial menopause

children.title: (b660) Procreation functions
children.description:
Functions associated with fertility, pregnancy, childbirth and lactation. 
 Inclusions: functions of male fertility and female fertility, pregnancy and childbirth, and lactation; impairments such as azoospermia, oligozoospermia, agalactorrhoea, galactorrhoea, alactation and such as in subfertility, sterility, spontaneous abortions, ectopicpregnancy, miscarriage, small fetus, hydramnios and premature childbirth, and delayed childbirth 
 Exclusions: sexual functions (b640); menstruation functions (b650)

children.title: (b6600) Functions related to fertility
children.description:
Functions related to the ability to produce gametes for procreation. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in subfertility and sterility 
 Exclusions: Sexual functions (b640)

children.title: (b6601) Functions related to pregnancy
children.description: Functions involved in becoming pregnant and being pregnant.

children.title: (b6602) Functions related to childbirth
children.description: Functions involved during childbirth.

children.title: (b6603) Lactation
children.description: Functions involved in the production of milk and making it available to the child.

children.title: (b670) Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions
children.description:
Sensations associated with sexual intercourse, menstruation, and related genital or reproductive functions 
 Inclusions: sensations of dyspareunia, dysmenorrhoea, hot flushes during menopause and night sweats during menopause, sensations associated with self-stimulation of the genitals 
 Exclusions: sensation of pain (b280); sensations associated with urinary functions (b630); sexual functions (b640); menstruation functions (b650); procreation functions (b660)

children.title: (b6700) Sensations associated with sexual intercourse
children.description: Sensations associated with sexual arousal, preparation, intercourse, orgasm and resolution.

children.title: (b6701) Sensations associated with the menstrual cycle
children.description: Sensations involved with menstruation, including pre- and post-menstrual phases.

children.title: (b6702) Sensations associated with menopause
children.description:
Sensations associated with the cessation of menstrual cycle. 
 Inclusions: hot flushes and night sweats during menopause

children.title: (b6703) Sensations associated with genital functions
children.description:
Sensations associated with arousal of the genitals. 
 Inclusions: sensations associated with self-stimulation of the genitals 
 Exclusions: sexual functions (b640); procreation functions (b660)

children.title: (b6708) Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions, other specified
(b6709) Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions, unspecified
(b679) Genital and reproductive functions, other specified and unspecified
(b698) Genitourinary and reproductive functions, other specified
(b710-729) Functions of the joints and bones
(b7100) Mobility of a single joint
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of one joint.

children.title: (b7101) Mobility of several joints
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of more than one joint.

children.title: (b7102) Mobility of joints generalized
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of joints throughout the body.

children.title: (b7108) Mobility of joint functions, other specified
(b7150) Stability of a single joint
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of one joint.

children.title: (b7151) Stability of several joints
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of more than one joint.

children.title: (b7152) Stability of joints generalized
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of joints throughout the body.

children.title: (b7158) Stability of joint functions, other specified
(b7200) Mobility of scapula
children.description:
Functions of the range and ease of movement of the scapula. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as protraction, retraction, laterorotation and medial rotation of the scapula

children.title: (b7201) Mobility of pelvis
children.description:
Functions of the range and ease of movement of the pelvis. 
 Inclusions: rotation of the pelvis

children.title: (b7202) Mobility of carpal bones
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the carpal bones.

children.title: (b7203) Mobility of tarsal bones
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the tarsal bones.

children.title: (b7208) Mobility of bone functions, other specified
(b729) Functions of the joints and bones, other specified and unspecified
(b7300) Power of isolated muscles and muscle groups
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of specific and isolated muscles and muscle groups. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as weakness of small muscles of feet or hands

children.title: (b7301) Power of muscles of one limb
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups of one arm or leg. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as monoparesis and monoplegia

children.title: (b7302) Power of muscles of one side of the body
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups found on the left or right side of the body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as hemiparesis and hemiplegia Search Fields

children.title: (b7303) Power of muscles in lower half of the body
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups found in the lower half of the body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as paraparesis and paraplegia

children.title: (b7304) Power of muscles of all limbs
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of muscles and muscle groups of all four limbs. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as tetraparesis and tetraplegia

children.title: (b7305) Power of muscles of the trunk
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of muscles and muscle groups in the trunk.

children.title: (b7306) Power of all muscles of the body
children.description:
Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of all muscles and muscle groups of the body. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as akinetic mutism

children.title: (b7350) Tone of isolated muscles and muscle groups
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting isolated muscles and muscle groups and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in focal dystonias, e.g. torticollis

children.title: (b7351) Tone of muscles of one limb
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in one arm or leg and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with monoparesis and monoplegia

children.title: (b7352) Tone of muscles of one side of body
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the right or left side of the body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with hemiparesis and hemiplegia
