children.title: (b7353) Tone of muscles of lower half of body
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in the lower half of the body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with paraparesis and paraplegia

children.title: (b7354) Tone of muscles of all limbs
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in all four limbs and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with tetraparesis and tetraplegia

children.title: (b7355) Tone of muscles of trunk
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the trunk and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: (b7356) Tone of all muscles of the body
children.description:
Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the whole body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as in generalized dystonias and Parkinson's disease, or general paresis and paralysis

children.title: (b7400) Endurance of isolated muscles
children.description: Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of isolated muscles for the required period of time.

children.title: (b7401) Endurance of muscle groups
children.description:
Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of isolated muscle groups for the required period of time. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with monoparesis, monoplegia, hemiparesis and hemiplegia, paraparesis and paraplegia

children.title: (b7402) Endurance of all muscles of the body
children.description:
Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of all muscles of the body for the required period of time. 
 Inclusions: impairments associated with tetraparesis, tetraplegia, general paresis and paralysis

children.title: (b749) Muscle functions, other specified and unspecified
(b7500) Stretch motor reflex
children.description: Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by stretching.

children.title: (b7501) Reflexes generated by noxious stimuli
children.description:
Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by painful or other noxious stimuli. 
 Inclusions: withdrawal reflex

children.title: (b7502) Reflexes generated by other exteroceptive stimuli
children.description:
Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by external stimuli other than noxious stimuli. 
 Inclusions: rooting, grasping, sucking and other primitive reflexes

children.title: (b755) Involuntary movement reaction functions
children.description:
Functions of involuntary contractions of large muscles or the whole body induced by body position, balance and threatening stimuli. 
 Inclusions: functions of postural reactions, righting reactions, body adjustment reactions, balance reactions, supporting reactions, defensive reactions 
 Exclusions: motor reflex functions (b750)

children.title: (b7600) Control of simple voluntary movements
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of simple or isolated voluntary movements.

children.title: (b7601) Control of complex voluntary movements
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of complex voluntary movements.

children.title: (b7602) Coordination of voluntary movements
children.description:
Functions associated with coordination of simple and complex voluntary movements, performing movements in an orderly combination. 
 Inclusions: right left coordination, coordination of visually directed movements, such as eye hand coordination and eye foot coordination; impairments such as dysdiadochokinesia

children.title: (b7603) Supportive functions of arm or leg
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of voluntary movements by placing weight either on the arms (elbows or hands) or on the legs (knees or feet).

children.title: (b7608) Control of voluntary movement functions, other specified
(b7609) Control of voluntary movement functions, unspecified
(b7610) General movements
children.description: Repertoire and quality of age-specific general spontaneous movements such as 'writhing' movements and 'fidgety' movements in early life.

children.title: (b7611) Specific spontaneous movements
children.description: Repertoire and quality of other spontaneous movements normally present in the first postnatal months, such as arm and leg movements toward midline, finger movements and kicking.

children.title: (b7650) Involuntary contractions of muscles
children.description:
Functions of unintentional, non- or semi-purposive involuntary contractions of a muscle or group of muscles, such as those involved in part of a psychological dysfunction. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as choreatic and athethotic movements; sleep-related movement disorders

children.title: (b7651) Tremor
children.description: Functions of alternating contraction and relaxation of a group of muscles around a joint, resulting in shakiness.

children.title: (b7652) Tics and mannerisms
children.description:
Functions of repetitive, quasi-purposive, involuntary contractions of a group of muscles. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as vocal tics, coprolalia and bruxism

children.title: (b7653) Stereotypies and motor perseveration
children.description: Functions of spontaneous, non-purposive movements such as repetively rocking to and fro and nodding the head or wiggling.

children.title: (b770) Gait pattern functions
children.description:
Functions of movement patterns associated with walking, running or other whole body movements. 
 Inclusions: walking patterns and running patterns; impairments such as spastic gait, hemiplegic gait, paraplegic gait, asymmetric gait, limping and stiff gait pattern 
 Exclusions: muscle power functions (b730); muscle tone functions (b735); control of voluntary movement functions (b760); involuntary movement functions (b765)

children.title: (b780) Sensations related to muscles and movement functions
(b7800) Sensation of muscle stiffness
children.description: Sensation of tightness or stiffness of muscles.

children.title: (b7801) Sensation of muscle spasm
children.description: Sensation of involuntary contraction of a muscle or a group of muscles.

children.title: (b7808) Sensations related to muscles and movement functions, other specified
(b7809) Sensations related to muscles and movement functions, unspecified
(b789) Movement functions, other specified and unspecified
(b798) Neuromusculoskeletal and movement-related functions, other specified
(b8) FUNCTIONS OF THE SKIN AND RELATED STRUCTURES
(b810) Protective functions of the skin
children.description:
Functions of the skin for protecting the body from physical, chemical and biological threats. 
 Inclusions: functions of protecting against the sun and other radiation, photosensitivity, pigmentation, quality of skin, insulating function of skin, callus formation, hardening; impairments such as broken skin, ulcers, bedsores and thinning of skin 
 Exclusions: repair functions of the skin (b820); other functions of the skin (b830)

children.title: (b820) Repair functions of the skin
children.description:
Functions of the skin for repairing breaks and other damage to the skin. 
 Inclusions: functions of scab formation, healing, scarring; bruising and keloid formation 
 Exclusions: protective functions of the skin (b810); other functions of the skin (b830)

children.title: (b830) Other functions of the skin
children.description:
Functions of the skin other than protection and repair, such as cooling and sweat secretion. 
 Inclusions: functions of sweating, glandular functions of the skin and resulting body odour 
 Exclusions: protective functions of the skin (b810); repair functions of the skin (b820)

children.title: (b840) Sensation related to the skin
children.description:
Sensations related to the skin such as itching, burning sensation and tingling. 
 Inclusions: impairments such as pins and needles sensation and crawling sensation 
 Exclusions: sensation of pain (b280)

children.title: (b849) Functions of the skin, other specified and unspecified
(b850-869) Functions of the hair and nails
(b850) Functions of hair
children.description:
Functions of the hair, such as protection, coloration and appearance. 
 Inclusions: functions of growth of hair, pigmentation of hair, location of hair; impairments such as loss of hair or alopecia

children.title: (b860) Functions of nails
children.description:
Functions of the nails, such as protection, scratching and appearance. 
 Inclusions: growth and pigmentation of nails, quality of nails

children.title: (b869) Functions of the hair and nails, other specified and unspecified
(b898) Functions of the skin and related structures, other specified
(b899) Functions of the skin and related structures, unspecified
(d110) Watching
children.description: Using the sense of seeing intentionally to experience visual stimuli, such as visually tracking an object, watching a sporting event, people, or children playing.

children.title: (d115) Listening
children.description: Using the sense of hearing intentionally to experience auditory stimuli, such as listening to a radio, to the human voice, to music, to a lecture or to a story told.

children.title: (d120) Other purposeful sensing
children.description: Using the body's other basic senses intentionally to experience stimuli, such as touching and feeling textures, tasting sweets or smelling flowers.

children.title: (d1200) Mouthing
children.description: Exploring objects using mouth or lips.

children.title: (d1201) Touching
children.description:
Exploring objects using hands, fingers or other limbs or body parts. 
 
 Exclusions: mouthing (d1200)

children.title: (d1202) Smelling
children.description: Sensing objects by bringing them to the nose or the nose to objects.

children.title: (d1203) Tasting
children.description: Exploring the taste of food or liquid by biting, chewing or sucking.

children.title: (d129) Purposeful sensory experiences, other specified and unspecified
(d130) Copying
children.description: Imitating or mimicking as a basic component of learning, such as copying a facial expression, a gesture, a sound, or the letters of an alphabet.

children.title: (d131) Learning through actions with objects
children.description:
Learning through simple actions on a single object, two or more objects, symbolic and pretend play, such as in hitting an object, banging blocks and playing with dolls or cars. 
 
 Exclusions: play (d9200); carrying, moving and handling objects d430-d449

children.title: (d1310) Learning through simple actions with a single object
children.description: Simple actions with a single object or toy by manipulating, banging, moving, dropping, etc.

children.title: (d1311) Learning through actions by relating objects
children.description: Simple actions relating two or more objects, toys or other materials without regard for the specific features of the objects, toys or materials.

children.title: (d1312) Learning through actions by relating objects with regard tospecific features
children.description: Actions relating two or more objects, toys or materials with regard to specific features, e.g. lid on box, cup on saucer.

children.title: (d1313) Learning by relating symbolically to objects
children.description: Relating to objects, toys or materials symbolically, such as feeding or dressing a doll or using a simulated environment.

children.title: (d1318) Learning through actions with objects, other specified
(d1319) Learning through actions with objects, unspecified
(d1320) Acquiring single words or meaningful symbols
children.description: Learning words or meaningful symbols such as graphic or manual signs or symbols.

children.title: (d1321) Combining words into phrases
children.description: Learning to combine words into phrases.

children.title: (d1322) Acquiring syntax
children.description: Learning to produce appropriately constructed sentences or set of sentences.

children.title: (d133) Acquiring an additional language
children.description:
Developing the competence to represent persons, objects, events, feelings through words, symbols, phrases and sentences, in an additional language such as a foreign language or signing. 
 
 Exclusions: acquiring language (d132); communication (d310-d399)

children.title: (d133) Rehearsing
children.description: Repeating a sequence of events or symbols as a basic component of learning, such as counting by tens or practising the recitation of a rhyme with gestures or chords on a musical instrument.

children.title: (d137) Acquiring concepts
children.description: Developing competence to understand and use basic and complex concepts related to characteristics of things, persons or events.

children.title: (d1370) Acquiring basic concepts
children.description: Learning to use such concepts as size, form, quantity, length, same, or opposite.

children.title: (d1371) Acquiring complex concepts
children.description: Learning to use such concepts as classification, grouping, reversibility, or seriation.

children.title: (d140) Learning to read
children.description: Developing the competence to read written material (including Braille and other symbols) with fluency and accuracy, such as recognizing characters and alphabet letters, sounding out written words with correct pronunciation, and understanding written words and phrases.

children.title: (d1400) Acquiring skills to recognize symbols
children.description: Learning basic actions of deciphering symbols such as figures, icons, characters, alphabet letters and words.

children.title: (d1401) Acquiring skills to sound out written words
children.description: Learning basic actions of sounding out characters, alphabet letters, symbols and words with correct pronunciation.

children.title: (d1402) Acquiring skills to understanding written words and phrases
children.description: Learning basic actions to grasp the meaning of written words and texts.

children.title: (d1450) Acquiring skills to use writing implements
children.description: Learning basic actions of writing down symbols or alphabet letters, such as holding a pencil, chalk or brush, writing a character or a symbol on a piece of paper, using a brailler, keyboard or peripheral device (mouse).

children.title: (d1451) Acquiring skills to write symbols, characters and alphabet letters
children.description: Learning basic actions to transpose a sound (morpheme) into a symbol or a character (grapheme).

children.title: (d1452) Acquiring skills to write words and phrases
children.description: Learning basic actions to transpose spoken words or ideas into written words or phrases.

children.title: (d150) Learning to calculate
children.description: Developing the competence to manipulate numbers and perform simple and complex mathematical operations, such as using mathematical signs for addition and subtraction and applying the correct mathematical operation to a problem.

children.title: (d1501) Acquiring skills to recognize numerals, arithmetic signs and symbols
children.description: Learning to recognize and use numbers.

children.title: (d1502) Acquiring skills in using basic operations
children.description: Learning to recognise symbols related to and to use operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

children.title: (d155) Acquiring skills
children.description:
Developing basic and complex competencies in integrated sets of actions or tasks so as to initiate and follow through with the acquisition of a skill, such as manipulating tools or toys or playing games. 
 Inclusions: acquiring basic and complex skill

children.title: (d1550) Acquiring basic skills
children.description: Learning elementary, purposeful actions, such as learning to use simple tools, such as pencils or eating utensils.

children.title: (d1551) Acquiring complex skills
children.description: Learning integrated sets of actions so as to follow rules, and to sequence and coordinate one's movements, such as learning to play games (e.g. football or chess) and to use a building tool.

children.title: (d159) Basic learning, other specified and unspecified
(d1600) Focusing attention on the person
children.description: Intentionally attending to features of other persons such as their face, touch or voice.

children.title: (d1601) Focusing attention on the environment
children.description: Intentionally attending to some element of the environment, such as changes in the quality, quantity or intensity of physical or social stimuli.

children.title: (d163) Thinking
children.description:
Formulating and manipulating ideas, concepts, and images, whether goal-oriented or not, either alone or with others, such as creating fiction, proving a theorem, playing with ideas, brainstorming, meditating, pondering, speculating, or reflecting. 
 
 Exclusions: solving problems (d175); making decisions (d177)

children.title: (d166) Reading
children.description:
Performing activities involved in the comprehension and interpretation of written language (e.g. books, instructions or newspapers in text or Braille), for the purpose of obtaining general knowledge or specific information. 
 
 Exclusions: learning to read (d140)

children.title: (d1700) Using general skills and strategies of the writing process
children.description: Applying words which convey appropriate meaning, employing conventional sentence structure.

children.title: (d1701) Using grammatical conventions in writing compositions
children.description: Applying standard spelling, punctuation and proper case forms etc.

children.title: (d1703) Using general skills and strategies to write compositions
children.description: Applying words and sentences to convey complex meaning and abstract ideas.

children.title: (d1720) Using skills and strategies to perform simple numeric calculations
children.description: Performing simple numeric operations such as counting, grouping, ordering and arithmetic calculations.

children.title: (d1721) Using skills and strategies to perform complex numeric operations and calculations
children.description: Applying mathematical procedures and methods such as algebra, calculus and geometry to solve problems.

children.title: (d1750) Solving simple problems
children.description: Finding solutions to a simple problem involving a single issue or question, by identifying and analysing the issue, developing solutions, evaluating the potential effects of the solutions and executing a chosen solution.

children.title: (d1751) Solving complex problems
children.description: Finding solutions to a complex problem involving multiple and interrelated issues, or several related problems, by identifying and analysing the issue, developing solutions, evaluating the potential effects of the solutions and executing a chosen solution.

children.title: (d177) Making decisions
children.description:
Making a choice among options, implementing the choice, and evaluating the effects of the choice, such as selecting and purchasing a specific item, or deciding to undertake and undertaking one task from among several tasks that need to be done. 
 
 Exclusions: thinking (d163); solving problems (d175)

children.title: (d179) Applying knowledge, other specified and unspecified
(d198) Learning and applying knowledge, other specified
(d2100) Undertaking a simple task
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space required for a simple task; executing a simple task with a single major component, such as reading a book, writing a letter, or making one's bed.

children.title: (d2101) Undertaking a complex task
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a single complex task; executing a complex task with more than one component, which may be carried out in sequence or simultaneously, such as arranging the furniture in one's home or completing an assignment for school.

children.title: (d2102) Undertaking a single task independently
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a simple or complex task; managing and executing a task on one's own and without the assistance of others.

children.title: (d2103) Undertaking a single task in a group
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a single task, simple or complex; managing and executing a task with people who are involved in some or all steps of the task.

children.title: (d2200) Carrying out multiple tasks
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space needed for several tasks, and managing and executing several tasks, together or sequentially.

children.title: (d2201) Completing multiple tasks
children.description: Completing several tasks, together or sequentially.

children.title: (d2202) Undertaking multiple tasks independently
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for multiple tasks, and managing and executing several tasks together or sequentially, on one's own and without the assistance of others.

children.title: (d2203) Undertaking multiple tasks in a group
children.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for multiple tasks, and managing and executing several tasks together or sequentially with others who are involved in some or all steps of the multiple tasks.

children.title: (d2301) Managing daily routine
children.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions in order to plan and manage the requirements of day-to-day procedures or duties.

children.title: (d2302) Completing the daily routine
children.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions in order to complete the requirements of usual day-to-day procedures or duties, such as getting dressed, eating breakfast, leaving for school or work and returning home at the end of the day.

children.title: (d2303) Managing one's own activity level
children.description: Carrying out actions and behaviours to arrange the requirements in energy and time day-to-day procedures or duties.

children.title: (d2304) Adapting to changes in daily routine
children.description: Interrupting and shifting tasks and actions in response to new requirements or making a transition from a usual pattern of activities to a new set of activities as a means of fulfilling daily tasks.

children.title: (d2308) Carrying out daily routine, other specified
(d240) Handling stress and other psychological demands
(d2400) Handling responsibilities
children.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions to manage the duties of task performance and to assess the requirements of these duties.

children.title: (d2401) Handling stress
children.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions to cope with pressure, emergencies or stress associated with task performance.

children.title: (d2402) Handling crisis
children.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions to cope with decisive turning points in a situation or times of acute danger or difficulty.

children.title: (d2408) Handling stress and other psychological demands, other specified
(d2409) Handling stress and other psychological demands, unspecified
(d298) General tasks and demands, other specified
(d3100) Communicating with - receiving - simple spoken messages
children.description: Comprehending the literal meaning conveyed by simple spoken messages.

children.title: (d3101) Communicating with - receiving - complex spoken messages
children.description: Comprehending the literal and implied meaning conveyed by complex spoken messages.

children.title: (d3108) Communicating with - receiving - spoken messages, other specified
(d3150) Communicating with - receiving - body gestures
children.description: Comprehending the meaning conveyed by facial expressions, hand movements or signs, body postures, and other forms of body language.

children.title: (d3151) Communicating with - receiving - general signs and symbols
children.description: Comprehending the meaning represented by public signs and symbols, such as traffic signs, warning symbols, musical or scientific notations, and icons.

children.title: (d3152) Communicating with - receiving - drawings and photographs
children.description: Comprehending the meaning represented by drawings (e.g. line drawings, graphic designs, paintings, three-dimensional representations, pictograms), graphs, charts and photographs, such as understanding that an upward line on a height chart indicates that a child is growing.

children.title: (d3158) Communicating with - receiving - nonverbal messages, other specified
(d3159) Communicating with - receiving - nonverbal messages, unspecified
(d320) Communicating with - receiving - formal sign language messages
children.description: Receiving and comprehending messages in formal sign language with literal and implied meaning.

children.title: (d329) Communicating - receiving, other specified and unspecified
(d3300) Producing meaningful sounds
children.description: Using single words to label objects, persons or actions such as ball, mommy, bye-bye.

children.title: (d3301) Producing simple spoken messages
children.description: Using words to produce simple spoken messages such as single or few words or expressing a need (e.g. I want ...) or feeling (e.g., I like ...).

children.title: (d3302) Producing complex spoken messages
children.description: Using words to produce complex spoken messages (complete sentences) such as giving an explanation or asking for directions.

children.title: (d331) Non-speech vocal expression
children.description:
Vocalising when aware of another person in the proximal environment, such as producing sounds when the mother is close; babbling; babbling in turn-taking activities. Vocalising in response to speech through imitating speech-sounds in a turn taking procedure. 
 
 Exclusions: singing (d332)

children.title: (d332) Singing
children.description:
Using tones in a sequence resulting in a melody to convey messages. 
 Inclusions: humming, chanting

children.title: (d3350) Producing body language
children.description: Conveying messages by intentional movements of the body, such as facial gestures (e.g. smiling, frowning, wincing), by arm and hand movements, and by postures (e.g. embracing to indicate affection or pointing to receive attention or an object).

children.title: (d3351) Producing signs and symbols
children.description: Conveying meaning by using signs and symbols (e.g. icons, Bliss board, scientific symbols) and symbolic notation systems, such as using musical notation to convey a melody.

children.title: (d3352) Producing drawings and photographs
children.description: Conveying meaning by drawing, painting, sketching, and making diagrams, pictures or photographs, such as drawing a map to give someone directions to a location.

children.title: (d340) Producing messages in formal sign language
children.description: Conveying, with formal sign language, literal and implied meaning.

children.title: (d345) Writing messages
children.description: Producing the literal and implied meanings of messages that are conveyed through written language, such as writing a letter to a friend.

children.title: (d349) Communication - producing, other specified and unspecified
(d350-369) Conversation and use of communication devices and techniques
(d3500) Starting a conversation
children.description: Beginning an interchange, such as initiating turn-taking activity through eye-contact or other means, that leads to communication or dialogue, such as by introducing oneself, expressing customary greetings, or by introducing a topic or asking questions.

children.title: (d3501) Sustaining a conversation
children.description: Continuing and shaping a dialogue or interchange by taking turns in vocalising, speaking or signing, by adding ideas, introducing a new topic or retrieving a topic that has been previously mentioned.

children.title: (d3502) Ending a conversation
children.description: Finishing a dialogue or interchange with customary termination statements or expressions and by bringing closure to the topic under discussion.

children.title: (d3503) Conversing with one person
children.description: Initiating, maintaining, shaping and terminating a dialogue or interchange with one person, such as in discussing the weather with a friend.

children.title: (d350) Conversing with many people
children.description: Initiating, maintaining, shaping and terminating a dialogue or interchange with more than one individual, such as in starting and participating in a group interchange.

children.title: (d3550) Discussion with one person
children.description: Initiating, maintaining, shaping or terminating an argument or debate with one person.

children.title: (d3551) Discussion with many people
children.description: Initiating, maintaining, shaping or terminating an argument or debate with more than one individual.

children.title: (d3600) Using telecommunication devices
children.description: Using telephones, computer, and other electronic devices as means of telecommunication.

children.title: (d3601) Using writing machines
children.description: Using machines for writing, such as typewriters, computers and Braille writers, as a means of communication.

children.title: (d3602) Using communication techniques
children.description: Performing actions and tasks involved in techniques for communicating, such as reading lips.

children.title: (d3608) Using communication devices and techniques, other specified
(d3609) Using communication devices and techniques, unspecified
(d369) Conversation and use of communication devices and techniques, other specified and unspecified
(d4100) Lying down
children.description:
Getting into and out of a lying down position or changing body position, from horizontal to any other position, such as standing up or sitting down. 
 Inclusions: getting into a prostrate position

children.title: (d4101) Squatting
children.description: Getting into and out of the seated or crouched posture on one's haunches with knees closely drawn up or sitting on one's heels, such as may be necessary in toilets that are at floor level, or changing body position from squatting to any other position, such as standing up.

children.title: (d4102) Kneeling
children.description: Getting into and out of a position where the body is supported by the knees with legs bent, such as during prayers, or changing body position from kneeling to any other position, such as standing up.

children.title: (d4103) Sitting
children.description:
Getting into and out of a seated position and changing body position from sitting down to any other position, such as standing up or lying down. 
 Inclusions: getting into a sitting position with bent legs or cross-legged; getting into a sitting position with feet supported or unsupported

children.title: (d4104) Standing
children.description: Getting into and out of a standing position or changing body position from standing to any other position, such as lying down or sitting down.

children.title: (d4105) Bending
children.description: Tilting the back downwards or to the side, at the torso, such as in bowing or reaching down for an object.

children.title: (d4106) Shifting the body's centre of gravity
children.description:
Adjusting or moving the weight of the body from one position to another while sitting, standing or lying, such as moving from one foot to another while standing. 
 
 Exclusions: transferring oneself (d420); walking (d450)

children.title: (d4107) Rolling Over
children.description: Moving the body from one position to another while lying such as turning from side to side or from stomach to back.

children.title: (d4108) Changing basic body position, other specified
(d4150) Maintaining a lying position
children.description:
Staying in a lying position for some time as required, such as remaining in a prone position in a bed. 
 Inclusions: staying in a prone (face down or prostrate), supine (face upwards) or side-lying position

children.title: (d4151) Maintaining a squatting position
children.description: Staying in a squatting position such as when sitting on the floor without a seat.

children.title: (d4152) Maintaining a kneeling position
children.description: Staying in a kneeling position where the body is supported by the knees with legs bent for some time such as during prayers in church.

children.title: (d4153) Maintaining a sitting position
children.description:
Staying in a seated position, on a seat or the floor, for some time such as when sitting at a desk or table. 
 Inclusions: staying in a sitting position with straight legs or cross-legged, with feet supported or unsupported

children.title: (d4154) Maintaining a standing position
children.description:
Staying in a standing position for some time as required, such as when standing in a queue. 
 Inclusions: staying in a standing position on a slope, on slippery or hard surfaces

children.title: (d4155) Maintaining head position
children.description: controlling the position of the head and supporting its weight for a determined period of time.

children.title: (d4158) Maintaining a body position, other specified
(d4200) Transferring oneself while sitting
children.description:
Moving from a sitting position on one seat to another seat on the same or a different level, such as moving from a chair to a bed. 
 Inclusions: moving from a chair to another seat, such as a toilet seat; moving from a wheelchair to a car seat 
 Exclusions: changing basic body position (d410)

children.title: (d4201) Transferring oneself while lying
children.description:
Moving from one lying position to another on the same or a different level, such as moving from one bed to another. 
 
 Exclusions: changing basic body position (d410)

children.title: (d429) Changing and maintaining body position, other specified and unspecified
(d4300) Lifting
children.description: Raising up an object in order to move it from a lower to a higher level, such as when lifting a glass from the table.

children.title: (d4301) Carrying in the hands
children.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the hands, such as when carrying a drinking glass or a suitcase.

children.title: (d4302) Carrying in the arms
children.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the arms and hands, such as when carrying a pet or a child or other large object.

children.title: (d4303) Carrying on shoulders, hip and back
children.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the shoulders, hip or back, or some combination of these, such as when carrying a large parcel or school bag.

children.title: (d4304) Carrying on the head
children.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the head, such when as carrying a container of water on the head.

children.title: (d4305) Putting down objects
children.description: Using hands, arms or other parts of the body to place an object down on a surface or place, such as when lowering a container of water to the ground.

children.title: (d4350) Pushing with lower extremities
children.description: Using the legs and feet to exert a force on an object to move it away, such as pushing a chair away with a foot.

children.title: (d4351) Kicking
children.description: Using the legs and feet to propel something away, such as kicking a ball.

children.title: (d4358) Moving objects with lower extremities, other specified
(d4359) Moving objects with lower extremities, unspecified
(d4400) Picking up
children.description: Lifting or taking up a small object with hands and fingers, such as when picking up a pencil.

children.title: (d4401) Grasping
children.description: Using one or both hands to seize and hold something, such as when grasping a tool or a door knob.

children.title: (d4402) Manipulating
children.description: Using fingers and hands to exert control over, direct or guide something, such as when handling coins or other small objects, such as scissors, shoe laces, pencils, chopsticks, knives and forks.

children.title: (d4403) Releasing
children.description: Using fingers and hands to let go or set free something so that it falls or changes position, such as when dropping an item of clothing or a piece of food for a pet.

children.title: (d4450) Pulling
children.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to bring an object towards oneself, or to move it from place to place, such as when pulling on a string or pulling a door closed.

children.title: (d4451) Pushing
children.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to move something from oneself, or to move it from place to place, such as when pushing a toy or an animal away.

children.title: (d4452) Reaching
children.description: Using the hands and arms to extend outwards and touch and grasp something, such as when reaching across a table or desk for a book.

children.title: (d4453) Turning or twisting the hands or arms
children.description: Using fingers, hands or arms to rotate, turn or bend an object as is required to open a jar or use tools such as a toothbrush or screwdriver.

children.title: (d4454) Throwing
children.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to lift something and propel it with some force through the air, such as when tossing a ball.

children.title: (d4455) Catching
children.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to grasp a moving object in order to bring it to a stop and hold it, such as when catching a ball.

children.title: (d4458) Hand and arm use, other specified
(d446) Fine foot use
children.description:
Performing the coordinated actions of picking up, manipulating and releasing objects using one's foot and toes. 
 
 Exclusions: moving objects with lower extremities (d435)

children.title: (d449) Carrying, moving and handling objects, other specified and unspecified
(d4500) Walking short distances
children.description: Walking for less than a kilometre, such as walking around rooms or hallways, within a building or for short distances outside.

children.title: (d4501) Walking long distances
children.description: Walking for more than a kilometre, such as across a village or town, between villages or across open areas.

children.title: (d4502) Walking on different surfaces
children.description: Walking on sloping, uneven, or moving surfaces, such as on grass, gravel or ice and snow, or walking aboard a ship, train or other vehicle.

children.title: (d4503) Walking around obstacles
children.description: Walking in ways required to avoid moving and immobile objects, people, animals, and vehicles, such as walking around a marketplace or shop, around or through traffic or other crowded areas.

children.title: (d4550) Crawling
children.description: Moving the whole body in a prone position from one place to another on hands, or hands and arms, and knees.

children.title: (d4551) Climbing
children.description: Moving the whole body upwards or downwards, over surfaces or objects, such as climbing steps, rocks, ladders or stairs, curbs or other objects.

children.title: (d4552) Running
children.description: Moving with quick steps so that both feet may be simultaneously off the ground.

children.title: (d4553) Jumping
children.description: Moving up off the ground by bending and extending the legs, such as jumping on one foot, hopping, skipping and jumping or diving into water.

children.title: (d4554) Swimming
children.description: Propelling the whole body through water by means of limb and body movements without taking support from the ground underneath.

children.title: (d4600) Moving around within the home
children.description:
Walking and moving around in one's home, within a room, between rooms, and around the whole residence or living area. 
 Inclusions: moving from floor to floor, on an attached balcony, moving in a restricted area such as a courtyard, porch or garden

children.title: (d4601) Moving around within buildings other than home
children.description:
Walking and moving around within buildings other than one's residence, such as other people's homes, other private buildings, community and public buildings and enclosed areas. 
 Inclusions: moving throughout all parts of buildings and enclosed areas, between floors, inside, outside and around buildings, both public and private

children.title: (d4602) Moving around outside the home and other buildings
children.description:
Walking and moving around close to or far from one's home and other buildings, without the use of transportation, public or private, such as walking for short or long distances around a town or village. 
 Inclusions: walking or moving down streets in the neighbourhood, town, village or city; moving between cities, without using transportation

children.title: (d4608) Moving around in different locations, other specified
(d4609) Moving around in different locations, unspecified
(d465) Moving around using equipment
children.description:
Moving the whole body from place to place, on any surface or space, by using specific devices designed to facilitate moving or create other ways of moving around, such as with skates, skis, or scuba equipment, or moving down the street in a self-propelled wheelchair or a walker. 
 
 Exclusions: transferring oneself (d420); walking (d450); moving around (d455); using transportation (d470); driving (d475)

children.title: (d469) Walking and moving, other specified and unspecified
(d4700) Using human-powered vehicles
children.description: Being transported as a passenger by a mode of transportation powered by one or more people, such as riding in a pram or stroller, wheelchair propelled by another, rickshaw or rowboat.

children.title: (d4701) Using private motorized transportation
children.description: Being transported as a passenger by private motorized vehicle over land, sea or air, such as by car, taxi or privately owned aircraft or boat.

children.title: (d4702) Using public motorized transportation
children.description: Being transported as a passenger by a motorized vehicle over land, sea or air designed for public transportation, such as being a passenger on a bus, train, subway or aircraft.

children.title: (d4703) Using humans for transportation
children.description: Being transported by another person, such as being carried in the arms, in a sheet or in a backpack.

children.title: (d4750) Driving human-powered transportation
children.description: Driving a human-powered vehicle, such as a bicycle, tricycle, or rowboat.

children.title: (d4751) Driving motorized vehicles
children.description: Driving a vehicle with a motor, such as an automobile, motorcycle, motorboat or aircraft.

children.title: (d4752) Driving animal-powered vehicles
children.description: Driving a vehicle powered by an animal, such as a horse-drawn cart or carriage.

children.title: (d489) Moving around using transportation, other specified and unspecified
(d5100) Washing body parts
children.description: Applying water, soap and other substances to body parts, such as hands, face, feet, hair or nails, in order to clean them.

children.title: (d5101) Washing whole body
children.description: Applying water, soap and other substances to the whole body in order to clean oneself, such as taking a bath or shower.

children.title: (d5102) Drying oneself
children.description: Using a towel or other means for drying some part or parts of one's body, or the whole body, such as after washing.

children.title: (d5200) Caring for skin
children.description: Looking after the texture and hydration of one's skin, such as by removing calluses or corns and using moisturizing lotions or cosmetics.

children.title: (d5201) Caring for teeth
children.description: Looking after dental hygiene, such as by brushing teeth, flossing, and taking care of a dental prosthesis or orthosis.

children.title: (d5202) Caring for hair
children.description: Looking after the hair on the head and face, such as by combing, styling, shaving, or trimming.

children.title: (d5203) Caring for fingernails
children.description: Cleaning, trimming or polishing the nails of the fingers.

children.title: (d5204) Caring for toenails
children.description: Cleaning, trimming or polishing the nails of the toes.

children.title: (d5205) Caring for nose
children.description: Cleaning the nose, looking after nasal hygiene.

children.title: (d5208) Caring for body parts, other specified
(d5300) Regulating urination
children.description: Coordinating and managing urination, such as by indicating need, getting into the proper position, choosing and getting to an appropriate place for urination, manipulating clothing before and after urination, and cleaning oneself after urination.

children.title: (d5301) Regulating defecation
children.description: Coordinating and managing defecation such as by indicating need, getting into the proper position, choosing and getting to an appropriate place for defecation, manipulating clothing before and after defecation, and cleaning oneself after defecation.

children.title: (d5302) Menstrual care
children.description: Coordinating, planning and caring for menstruation, such as by anticipating menstruation and using sanitary towels and napkins.

children.title: (d5400) Putting on clothes
children.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of putting clothes on various parts of the body, such as putting clothes on over the head, over the arms and shoulders, and on the lower and upper halves of the body; putting on gloves and headgear.

children.title: (d5401) Taking off clothes
children.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of taking clothes off various parts of the body, such as pulling clothes off and over the head, off the arms and shoulders, and off the lower and upper halves of the body; taking off gloves and headgear.

children.title: (d5402) Putting on footwear
children.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of putting on socks, stockings and footwear.

children.title: (d5403) Taking off footwear
children.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of taking off socks, stockings and footwear.

children.title: (d5404) Choosing appropriate clothing
children.description: Following implicit or explicit dress codes and conventions of one's society or culture and dressing in keeping with climatic conditions.

children.title: (d5700) Ensuring one's physical comfort
children.description: Caring for oneself by being aware that one needs to ensure, and ensuring, that one's body is in a comfortable position, that one is not feeling too hot, cold or wet, and that one has adequate lighting.

children.title: (d5701) Managing diet and fitness
children.description: Caring for oneself by being aware of the need and by selecting and consuming nutritious foods and maintaining physical fitness.

children.title: (d5702) Maintaining one's health
children.description: Caring for oneself by being aware of the need and doing what is required to look after one's health, both to respond to risks to health and to prevent ill-health, such as by seeking assistance (professional and non professional); following medical and other health advice; and managing risks to health such as injuries, communicable diseases, drug-taking and sexual transmitted diseases.

children.title: (d5708) Looking after one's health, other specified
(d6100) Buying a place to live
children.description: Acquiring ownership of a house, apartment or other dwelling.

children.title: (d6101) Renting a place to live
children.description: Acquiring the use of a house, apartment or other dwelling belonging to another in exchange for payment.

children.title: (d6102) Furnishing a place to live
children.description: Equipping and arranging a living space with furniture, fixtures and other fittings and decorating rooms, arranging one's own space or room.

children.title: (d6108) Acquiring a place to live, other specified
(d6109) Acquiring a place to live, unspecified
(d6200) Shopping
children.description: Obtaining, in exchange for money, goods and services required for daily living (including instructing and supervising an intermediate to do the shopping), such as selecting food, drink, cleaning materials, household items, play and recreational materials, or clothing in a shop or market; comparing quality and price of the items required, negotiating and paying for selected goods or services and transporting goods.

children.title: (d6201) Gathering daily necessities
children.description: Obtaining, without exchange of money, goods and services required for daily living (including instructing and supervising an intermediate to gather daily necessities), such as by harvesting vegetable and fruits and getting water and fuel.

children.title: (d6208) Acquisition of goods and services, other specified
(d6209) Acquisition of goods and services, unspecified
(d629) Acquisition of necessities, other specified and unspecified
(d6300) Preparing simple meals
children.description: Planning, organizing, cooking and serving meals with small number of ingredients that require easy methods of preparation and serving, such as making a snack or small meal, and transforming food ingredients by cutting and stirring, boiling and heating food such as rice or potatoes.

children.title: (d6301) Preparing complex meals
children.description:
Planning, organizing, cooking and serving meals with large number of ingredients that require complex methods of preparation and serving, such as planning a meal with serveral dishes, and transforming food ingredients by combined actions of peeling, slicing, mixing, kneading, stirring, presenting and serving food in a manner appropriate to the occasion and culture. 
 
 Exclusions: using household appliances (d6403)

children.title: (d6400) Washing and drying clothes and garments
children.description: Washing clothes and garments by hand and hanging them out to dry in the air.

children.title: (d6401) Cleaning cooking area and utensils
children.description: Cleaning up after cooking, such as by washing dishes, pans, pots and cooking utensils, and cleaning tables and floors around cooking and eating area.

children.title: (d6402) Cleaning living area
children.description: Cleaning the living areas of the household, such as by tidying and dusting, sweeping, swabbing, mopping floors, cleaning windows and walls, cleaning bathrooms and toilets, cleaning household furnishings.

children.title: (d6403) Using household appliances
children.description: Using all kinds of household appliances, such as washing machines, driers, irons, vacuum cleaners, dishwashers.

children.title: (d6404) Storing daily necessities
children.description: Storing food, drinks, clothes and other household goods required for daily living; preparing food for conservation by canning, salting or refrigerating, keeping food fresh and out of the reach of animals.

children.title: (d6405) Disposing of garbage
children.description: Disposing of household garbage such as by collecting trash and rubbish around the house, preparing garbage for disposal, using garbage disposal appliances; burning garbage.

children.title: (d649) Household tasks, other specified and unspecified
(d650-669) Caring for household objects and assisting others
(d6500) Making and repairing clothes
children.description:
Making and repairing clothes, such as by sewing, producing or mending clothes; reattaching buttons and fasteners; ironing clothes, fixing and polishing footwear. 
 
 Exclusions: using household appliances (d6403)

children.title: (d6501) Maintaining dwelling and furnishings
children.description: Repairing and taking care of dwelling, its exterior, interior and contents, such as by painting, repairing fixtures and furniture, and using required tools for repair work.

children.title: (d6502) Maintaining domestic appliances
children.description: Repairing and taking care of all domestic appliances for cooking, cleaning and repairing, such as by oiling and repairing tools and maintaining the washing machine.

children.title: (d6503) Maintaining vehicles
children.description: Repairing and taking care of motorized and non-motorized vehicles for personal use, including bicycles, carts, automobiles and boats.

children.title: (d6504) Maintaining assistive devices
children.description: Repairing and taking care of assistive devices such as prostheses, orthoses and specialized tools and aids for housekeeping and personal care; maintaining and repairing aids for personal mobility such as canes, walkers, wheelchairs and scooters; and maintaining communication and recreational aids.

children.title: (d6505) Taking care of plants, indoors and outdoors
children.description: Taking care of plants inside and outside the house, such as by planting, watering and fertilizing plants; gardening and growing foods for personal use.

children.title: (d6506) Taking care of animals
children.description: Taking care of domestic animals and pets, such as by feeding, cleaning, grooming and exercising pets; watching over the health of animals or pets; planning for the care of animals or pets in one's absence.

children.title: (d6508) Caring for household objects, other specified
(d6600) Assisting others with self-care
children.description: Assisting household members and others in performing self-care, including helping others with eating, bathing and dressing; taking care of children or members of the household who are sick or have difficulties with basic self-care; helping others with their toileting.

children.title: (d6601) Assisting others in movement
children.description: Assisting household members and others in movements and in moving outside the home, such as in the neighbourhood or city, to or from school, place of employment or other destination.

children.title: (d6602) Assisting others in communication
children.description: Assisting household members and others with their communication, such as by helping with speaking, writing or readings.

children.title: (d6603) Assisting others in interpersonal relations
children.description: Assisting household members and others with their interpersonal interactions, such as by helping them to initiate, maintain or terminate relationships.

children.title: (d6604) Assisting others in nutrition
children.description: Assisting household members and others with their nutrition, such as by helping them to prepare and eat meals.

children.title: (d6605) Assisting others in health maintenance
children.description: Assisting household members and others with formal and informal health care, such as by ensuring that a child gets regular medical check-ups, or that an elderly relative takes required medication.

children.title: (d669) Caring for household objects and assisting others, other specified and unspecified
(d7100) Respect and warmth in relationships
children.description: Showing and responding to consideration and esteem, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7101) Appreciation in relationships
children.description: Showing and responding to satisfaction and gratitude, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7102) Tolerance in relationships
children.description: Showing and responding to understanding and acceptance of behaviour, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7103) Criticism in relationships
children.description: Providing and responding to implicit and explicit differences of opinion or disagreement, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7104) Social cues in relationships
children.description: Giving and reacting appropriately to signs and hints that occur in social interactions.

children.title: (d7105) Physical contact in relationships
children.description: Making and responding to bodily contact with others, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7106) Differentiation of familiar persons
children.description: Showing differential responses to individuals, such as by reaching out for the familiar person and differentiating them from strangers and reacting in an appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7200) Forming relationships
children.description: Beginning and maintaining interactions with others for a short or long period of time, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner, such as by introducing oneself, finding and establishing friendships and professional relationships, starting a relationship that may become permanent, romantic or intimate.

children.title: (d7201) Terminating relationships
children.description: Bringing interactions to a close in a contextually and socially appropriate manner, such as by ending temporary relationships at the end of a visit, ending long-term relationships with friends when moving to a new town or ending relationships with work colleagues, professional colleagues and service providers, and ending romantic or intimate relationships.

children.title: (d7202) Regulating behaviours within interactions
children.description: Regulating emotions and impulses, verbal aggression and physical aggression in interactions with others, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

children.title: (d7203) Interacting according to social rules
children.description: Acting independently in social interactions and complying with social conventions governing one's role, position or other social status in interactions with others.

children.title: (d7204) Maintaining social space
children.description: Being aware of and maintaining a distance between oneself and others that is contextually, socially and culturally appropriate.

children.title: (d729) General interpersonal interactions, other specified and unspecified
(d730) Relating with strangers
children.description: Engaging in temporary contacts and links with strangers for specific purposes, when asking for directions or other information, or making a purchase.

children.title: (d7400) Relating with persons in authority
children.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in positions of power of a higher rank or prestige relative to one's own position, such as an employer.

children.title: (d7401) Relating with subordinates
children.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in positions of lower rank or prestige relative to one's own social position, such as an employee or servant.

children.title: (d7402) Relating with equals
children.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in the same position of authority, rank or prestige relative to one's own social position.

children.title: (d7500) Informal relationships with friends
children.description: Creating and maintaining friendship relationships that are characterized by mutual esteem an common interests.

children.title: (d7501) Informal relationships with neighbours
children.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who live in nearby dwellings or living areas.

children.title: (d7502) Informal relationships with acquaintances
children.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people whom one knows but who are not close friends.

children.title: (d7503) Informal relationships with co-inhabitants
children.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who are co-inhabitants of a house or other dwelling, privately or publicly run, for any purpose.

children.title: (d7504) Informal relationships with peers
children.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who share the same age, interest or other common feature.

children.title: (d7600) Parent-child relationships
children.description: Becomming and being a parent, both natural and adoptive, such as by having a child and relating to it as a parent or creating and maintaining a parental relationships with an adoptive child, and providing physical, intellectual and emotional nurture to one's natural or adoptive child.

children.title: (d7601) Child-parent relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining relationships with one's parent, such as a young child obeying his or her parents or an adult child taking care of his or her elderly parents.

children.title: (d7602) Sibling relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining a brotherly or sisterly relationship with a person who shares one or both parents by birth, adoption or marriage.

children.title: (d7603) Extended family relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining a family relationship with members of one's extended family, such as with cousins, aunts and uncles and grandparents.

children.title: (d7700) Romantic relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining a relationship based on emotional and physical attraction, potentially leading to long-term intimate relationships.

children.title: (d7701) Spousal relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining an intimate relationship of a legal nature with another person, such as in a legal marriage, including becoming and being a legally maried wife or husband or an unmarried spouse.

children.title: (d7702) Sexual relationships
children.description: Creating and maintaining a relationship of a sexual nature, with a spouse or other partner.

children.title: (d779) Particular interpersonal relationships, other specified and unspecified
(d798) Interpersonal interactions and relationships, other specifiedInterpersonal interactions and relationships, other specified
(d810) Informal education
children.description: Learning at home or in some other non-institutional setting, such as learning crafts and other skills from parents or family members, or home schooling.

children.title: (d815) Preschool education
children.description: Learning at an initial level of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce a child to the school-type environment and prepare it for compulsory education, such as by acquiring skills in a day-care or similar setting as preparation for advancement to school.

children.title: (d820) School education
children.description: Gaining admission to school, education, engaging in all school-related responsibilities and privileges, and learning the course material, subjects and other curriculum requirements in a primary or secondary education programme, including attending school regularly, working cooperatively with other students, taking directions from teachers, organizing, studying and completing assigned tasks and projects, and advancing to other stages of education.

children.title: (d825) Vocational training
children.description: Engaging in all activities of a vocational programme and learning the curriculum material for preparation for employment in a trade, job or profession.

children.title: (d830) Higher education
children.description: Engaging in the activities of advanced educational programmes in universities, colleges and professional schools and learning all aspects of the curriculum required for degrees, diplomas, certificates and other accreditations, such as completing a university bachelor's or master's course of study, medical school or other professional school.

children.title: (d835) Education life
children.description: Engaging in aspects of life of education institutions, such as university and school related associations, including: clubs, sports, related civic bodies (e.g. school council), and other institutionally-organized initiatives that are not part of the academic curriculum.

children.title: (d840) Apprenticeship (work preparation)
children.description:
Engaging in programmes related to preparation for employment, such as performing the tasks required of an apprenticeship, internship, articling and in-service training. 
 
 Exclusions: vocational training (d825)

children.title: (d845) Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job
(d8450) Seeking employment
children.description: Locating and choosing a job, in a trade, profession or other form of employment, and performing the required tasks to get hired, such as showing up at the place of employment or participating in a job interview.

children.title: (d8451) Maintaining a job
children.description: Performing job-related tasks to keep an occupation, trade, profession or other form of employment, and obtaining promotion and other advancements in employment.

children.title: (d8452) Terminating a job
children.description: Leaving or quitting a job in the appropriate manner.

children.title: (d8458) Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job, other specified
(d8459) Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job, unspecified
(d8500) Self employment
children.description:
Engaging in remunerative work sought or generated by the individual, or contracted from others without a formal employment relationship, such as migratory agricultural work, working as a free-lance writer or consultant, short-term contract work, working as an artist or crafts person, owning and running a shop or other business. 
 
 Exclusions: part-time and full-time employment (d8501, d8502)

children.title: (d8501) Part-time employment
children.description: Engaging in all aspects of work for payment on a part-time basis, as an employee, such as seeking employment and getting a job, doing the tasks required of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups.

children.title: (d8502) Full-time employment
children.description: Engaging in all aspects of work for payment on a full-time basis, as an employee, such as seeking employment and getting a job, doing the required tasks of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups.

children.title: (d855) Non-remunerative employment
children.description:
Engaging in all aspects of work in which pay is not provided, full-time or part-time, including organized work activities, doing the required tasks of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups, such as volunteer work, charity work, working for a community or religious group without remuneration, working around the home without remuneration. 
 
 Exclusions: Chapter 6 Domestic Life (d6)

children.title: (d859) Work and employment, other specified and unspecified
(d860) Basic economic transactions
children.description: Engaging in any form of simple economic transaction, such as using money to purchase food or bartering, exchanging goods or services; or saving money.

children.title: (d865) Complex economic transactions
children.description: Engaging in any form of complex economic transaction that involves the exchange of capital or property, and the creation of profit or economic value, such as buying a business, factory, or equipment, maintaining a bank account, or trading in commodities.

children.title: (d8700) Personal economic resources
children.description: Having command over personal or private economic resources, in order to ensure economical security for present and future needs.

children.title: (d8701) Public economic entitlements
children.description: Having command over public economic resources, in order to ensure economical security for present and future needs.

children.title: (d879) Economic life, other specified and unspecified
(d9100) Informal associations
children.description: Engaging in social or community associations organized by people with common interests, such as local social clubs or ethics groups.

children.title: (d9101) Formal associations
children.description: Engaging in professional or other exclusive social groups, such as associations of lawyers, physicians, or academics.

children.title: (d9102) Ceremonies
children.description: Engaging in non-religious rites or social ceremonies, such as marriages, funerals or initiation ceremonies.

children.title: (d9200) Play
children.description: Engaging in games with rules or unstructured or unorganized games and spontaneous recreation, such as playing chess or cards or children's play.

children.title: (d9201) Sports
children.description: Engaging in competitive and informal or formally organized games or athletic events, performed alone or in a group, such as bowling, gymnastics or soccer.

children.title: (d9202) Arts and culture
children.description: Engaging in, or appreciating, fine arts or cultural events, such as going to the theatre, cinema, museum or art gallery, or acting in a play, reading, being read to, dancing, singing or playing a musical instrument for enjoyment.

children.title: (d9203) Crafts
children.description: Engaging in handicrafts, such as pottery or knitting.

children.title: (d9204) Hobbies
children.description: Engaging in pastimes such as stamp collecting, coins or antiques.

children.title: (d9205) Socializing
children.description: Engaging in informal or casual gatherings with others, such as visiting friends or relatives or meeting informally in public places.

children.title: (d9300) Organized religion
children.description: Engaging in organized religious ceremonies, activities and events.

children.title: (d9301) Spirituality
children.description: Engaging in spiritual activities or events, outside of a organized religion.

children.title: (d940) Human rights
children.description:
Enjoying all nationally and internationally recognized rights that are accorded to people by virtue of their humanity alone, such as human rights as recognized by the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948), the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (1989), the United Nations Standard Rules for the Equalisation of Opportunities for Persons with Disabilities (1993), and the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (2006); the right to self-determination or autonomy; and the right to control over one's destiny. 
 
 Exclusions: Political life and citizenship (d950)

children.title: (d950) Political life and citizenship
children.description:
Engaging in the social, political, governmental life of a citizen, having legal status as a citizen and enjoying the rights, protections, privileges and duties associated with that role, such as the right to vote and run for political office, to form political associations, enjoying the rights and freedoms associated with citizenship (e.g. the rights of freedom of speech, association, religion, protections against unreasonable search and seizure, the right to counsel, to a trial and other legal rights and protections against discrimination); having legal standing as a citizen. 
 
 Exclusions: human rights (d940)

children.title: (d998) Community, social and civic life, other specified
(d998) Community, social and civic life, unspecified
(e110) Products or substances for personal consumption
children.description:
Any natural or human-made object or substance gathered, processed or manufactured for ingestion. 
 Inclusions: food and drugs

children.title: (e1100) Food
children.description: Any natural or human-made object or substance gathered, processed or manufactured to be consumed, such as raw, processed and prepared food and liquids of different consistencies (including breast milk), herbs and minerals (vitamin and other supplements).

children.title: (e1101) Drugs
children.description: Any natural or human-made object or substance gathered, processed or manufactured for medicinal purposes, such as allopathic and naturopathic medication.

children.title: (e1108) Products or substances for personal consumption, other specified
(e1109) Products or substances for personal consumption, unspecified
(e115) Products and technology for personal use in daily living
children.description:
Equipment, products and technologies used by people in daily activities, including those adapted or specially designed, located in, on or near the person using them. 
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for personal use 
 Exclusions: products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation (e120);products and technology for communication (e125)

children.title: (e1150) General products and technology for personal use in daily living
children.description: Equipment, products and technologies used by people in daily activities, such as clothes, textiles, furniture, appliances, cleaning products and tools, not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1151) Assistive products and technology for personal use in daily living
children.description: Adapted or specially designed equipment, products and technologies that assist people in daily living, such as prosthetic and orthotic devices, neural prostheses (e.g. functional stimulation devices that control bowels, bladder, breathing and heart rate), and environmental control units aimed at facilitating individuals' control over their indoor setting (scanners, remote control systems, voice-controlled systems, timer switches).

children.title: (e1158) Products and technology for personal use in daily living, other specified
(e1159) Products and technology for personal use in daily living, unspecified
(e120) Products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation
children.description:
Equipment, products and technologies used by people in activities of moving inside and outside buildings, including those adapted or specially designed, located in, on or near the person using them.
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation

children.title: (e1200) General products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation
children.description: Equipment, products and technologies used by people in activities of moving inside and outside buildings, such as motorized and non-motorized vehicles used for the transportation of people over ground, water and air (e.g. buses, cars, vans, other motor-powered vehicles and animal-powered transporters), not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1201) Assistive products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation
children.description: Adapted or specially designed equipment, products and technologies that assist people to move inside and outside buildings, such as walking devices (such as canes or crutches), special cars and vans, adaptations to vehicles, wheelchairs, scooters and transfer devices.

children.title: (e1208) Products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation, other specified
(e1209) Products and technology for personal indoor and outdoor mobility and transportation, unspecified
(e125) Products and technology for communication
children.description:
Equipment, products and technologies used by people in activities of sending and receiving information, including those adapted or specially designed, located in, on or near the person using them. 
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for communication

children.title: (e1250) General products and technology for communication
children.description: Equipment, products and technologies used by people in activities of sending and receiving information, such as optical and auditory devices, audio recorders and receivers, television and video equipment, telephone devices, sound transmission systems and face-to-face communication devices, not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1251) Assistive products and technology for communication
children.description: Adapted or specially designed equipment, products and technologies that assist people to send and receive information, such as specialized vision devices, drawing or handwriting devices, signalling systems and special computer software and hardware, cochlear implants, hearing aids, FM auditory trainers, voice prostheses, communication boards, glasses and contact lenses.

children.title: (e1258) Products and technology for communication, other specified
(e1259) Products and technology for communication, unspecified
(e130) Products and technology for education
children.description:
Equipment, products, methods and technology used for acquisition of knowledge, expertise or skill, including those adapted or specially designed. 
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for education

children.title: (e1300) General products and technology for education
children.description: Equipment, products, methods and technology used for acquisition of knowledge, expertise or skill at any level, such as books, manuals, educational toys, computer hardware or software, not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1301) Assistive products and technology for education
children.description: Adapted and specially designed equipment, products, processes, methods and technology used for acquisition of knowledge, expertise or skill, such as specialized computer technology.

children.title: (e1308) Products and technology for education, other specified
(e1309) Products and technology for education, unspecified
(e135) Products and technology for employment
children.description:
Equipment, products and technology used for employment to facilitate work activities. 
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for employment

children.title: (e1350) General products and technology for employment
children.description: Equipment, products and technology used for employment to facilitate work activities, not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1351) Assistive products and technology for employment
children.description: Adapted or specially designed equipment, products and technology used for employment to facilitate work activities, such as adjustable table, desks and filing cabinets; remote control entry and exit of office doors; computer hardware, software, accessories and environmental control units aimed at facilitating an individual's conduct of work-related tasks and aimed at control of the work environment (e.g. scanners, remote control systems, voice controlled systems, timer switches).

children.title: (e1358) Products and technology for employment, other specified
(e1359) Products and technology for employment, unspecified
(e140) Products and technology for culture, recreation and sport
children.description:
Equipment, products and technology used for the conduct and enhancement of cultural, recreational and sporting activities, including those adapted or specially designed. 
 Inclusions: general and assistive products and technology for culture, recreation and sport

children.title: (e1400) General products and technology for culture, recreation and sport
children.description: Equipment, products and technology used for the conduct and enhancement of cultural, recreational and sporting activities, not adapted or specially designed.

children.title: (e1401) Assistive products and technology for culture, recreation and sport
